entry.title: A note on the light velocity anisotropy
entry.summary: In the framework of linear transformations between inertial systems, there are no physical reasons for assuming any anisotropy in the one-way velocity of light.

entry.title: On the possibility of a complex 4-dimensional space-time manifold
entry.summary: The possibility of a complex 4-dimensional space-time manifold is suggested. This may imply the existence of a matter wave.

entry.title: On the passibility of a short-lived free Dirac particle
entry.summary: A time-decaying Dirac equation is suggested. For a free particle with rest mass about 0.5GeV, the live-time is about 10**(-25) second in the rest frame.

entry.title: Probability and Dirac equation
entry.summary: The Dirac equation is deduced from the probability properties by the Poincare group transformations.

entry.title: Comments on Superluminal Photon Tunneling
entry.summary: Various expressions for transit times in frustrated total internal reflection are analysed. The incompatibility of evanescent-wave propagation with Einstein causality is established.

entry.title: The Probability Distribution to Leptons and Quarks
entry.summary: The tracelike probability is expressed by the leptons and quarks Hamiltonians.

entry.title: A Brief Note on Jupiter's Magnetism
entry.summary: A recent model which gives the contribution of the earth's solid core to geo magnetism is seen to explain Jupiter's magnetism also.

entry.title: Fermi Temperature Magnetic Effects
entry.summary: Recent results than an assembly of Fermions below the Fermi temperature would exhibit anamolous semionic behaviour are examined in the context of assoociated magnetic fields.

entry.title: Quiet Violin
entry.summary: This is a letter to editor, about a previously published paper and comments.

entry.title: Why the Parity Violation
entry.summary: The sufficient and necessary conditions for a nonzero fermion mass without Higgs are considered. The Parity Violation is deduced from these conditions.

entry.title: The Rest Mass of the Hydrogen Atom from First Principles
entry.summary: The rest mass of the hydrogen atom in its ground state is calculated from first physical principles and elementary geometric considerations.

entry.title: Relativistic Kinematic Anomaly
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn

entry.title: The Fractal Universe
entry.summary: In this talk, we touch upon the chaotic and fractal aspects of the Universe.

entry.title: Scale Dependent Dimensionality
entry.summary: We argue that dimensionality is not absolute, but that it depends on the scale of resolution, from the Planck to the macro scale.

entry.title: An Underpinning for Space Time
entry.summary: We argue, that from a background pre space-time Zero Point Field, physical space-time emerges on averaging over unphysical Compton scales.

entry.title: Bell's theorem, entanglement, and common sense
entry.summary: A simple analogy to understand the quantum-mechanical entanglement within local-realistic world is presented.

entry.title: On the geometry of plasma reactor
entry.summary: It is presented the concept of controled nuclear synthesis in top of cone formed by rotational dynamic flow of low-temperature plasma.

entry.title: Whence the Gauge Fields arise
entry.summary: A gauge fields (and massive, too) arise from the production of the probability by the spinors.

entry.title: Quantum string field theory and psychophysics
entry.summary: The quantum string field theoretic structure of interactive phenomena is discussed

entry.title: Psychophysical quantum-string Weltdrama
entry.summary: Hypothesis of an existence of the universal quantum string field for all interactive phenomena is formulated. Its practical value is clarified.

entry.title: Perfectly secure cipher system
entry.summary: We present a perfectly secure cipher system based on the concept of fake bits which has never been used in either classical or quantum cryptography.

entry.title: Definition of the elements of length and time by means of photon
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to the presented idea is wrong.

entry.title: Number counts against K-corrections
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to the presented idea is wrong.

entry.title: The second "Einstein paradox"
entry.summary: Time invariance problem of a photon absorption process in atoms and molecules is discussed.

entry.title: The generation of gravitational waves
entry.summary: A proof that the generation of gravitational waves is physically impossible.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, PDF, submitted to Physical Review Letters

entry.title: Are Short and Long Gamma Ray Bursts Really of Different Origin?
entry.summary: It is shown that short and long gamma ray bursts (GRBs) are of the same origin and, furthermore, correlated with their duration.

entry.title: Mathematical Model of Shock Waves
entry.summary: Presented here is the mathematical model describing the phenomenon of shock waves. The underlying concept is based on the time-space model of wave propagation.

entry.title: Classical teleportation
entry.summary: The examples of "classical teleportation" are done and discussed. Like "quantum ones" they are far away from the science-fiction prototype.

entry.title: Newtonian gravity, red shift, confinement, asymptotic freedom and quarks oscillations
entry.summary: Quarks oscillations give the Newtonian gravity law, the red shift, the confinement and the asymptotic freedom.

entry.title: Stresses, energy flow and energy density of gravitational nature
entry.summary: Two arguments which show the validity of the concept of gravitational energy put forward by Lorentz and Levi-Civita.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.title: Quantum string field psychophysics of nastroenie
entry.summary: Some conceptual aspects of the quantum string field psychophysics are clarified.

entry.title: On the physical nature of the fluorescence depletion effect
entry.summary: The physical nature of the fluorescence depletion (FD) effect and the possible way of its experimental study are discussed.

entry.title: The Franck-Hertz experiment re-considered
entry.summary: The celebrated Franck-Hertz experiment is reinterpreted by analogy with the Glimmentladung experiment, formerly performed by Heinrich Hertz.

entry.title: Relativistic trajectories
entry.summary: A quite evident and radical argument proves that no motion of masses can generate gravitational waves.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.title: Relativistic spherical symmetries
entry.summary: The observational "black holes" are quite different objects from the theoretical black holes.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.title: A derivation of the homogenous Maxwell equations
entry.summary: We present a theoretical derivation of the homogenous Maxwell equations, based on Stokes theorem for Minkowski space tensors.

entry.title: Gravitation and Electromagnetism II
entry.summary: We show how, a non commutative underpinning for spacetime throws up mass, spin and charge and indicate how it is possible to include QCD effects also.

entry.title: A Note on "Extension, Spin and Non Commutativity"
entry.summary: We show that the Dirac theory of the electron, corresponds to recent approaches based on a Non commutative spacetime.

entry.title: Relativistic motions
entry.summary: A physical consequence of a well-known Fermi's theorem: no motion of masses can generate gravitational waves.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.title: Gravity and motion
entry.summary: Several arguments concerning the "vexatae quaestiones" of the gravity field of a point mass and of the wavy gravity field.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.title: How and in What Sense Can the Entropy Be Measured?
entry.summary: In this paper, a method of measuring the entropy is presented. Problems related to the entropy and the heat are also discussed.

entry.title: Do we live in an anthropic universe?
entry.summary: I cast doubt upon the desired consistency between the anthropic principle and modern cosmology.

author.name: Domingos Soares
author.arxiv:affiliation: Physics Department, UFMG, Brazil

entry.title: Analise Termodinamica de um circuito RLC
entry.summary: We analyse a RLC circuit taking the Second Law of Thermodynamics into consideration.

entry.title: Inconsistent Universe
entry.summary: Physics is introduced as a semantics of a formal set theory.

author.name: Hitoshi Kitada
author.arxiv:affiliation: University of Tokyo

entry.title: Explicit Solution For Klein-Gordon Equation, in Four Dimensions, For any Arbitrary potential. A New Approach
entry.summary: Klein-Gordon Equation has been solved in four dimension. The potential has been chosen to be any arbitrary field Potential.

entry.title: Friction as Basis for a Phonon Maser
entry.summary: Evidence is provided from experiment, for the hypothesis that defect organization (internal friction) is a means for operation of a phonon maser.

entry.title: Gravitational waves and ether's wind
entry.summary: A very recent research validates observationally the theoretical demonstrations of the physical non-existence of the gravitational waves.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, LaTeX, submitted to Il Nuovo Saggiatore

entry.title: The Black Holes do not exist - "Also Sprach Karl Schwarzschild"
entry.summary: According to the original theoretical analysis of 1916 by Karl Schwarzschild the black holes do not have a physical reality.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.title: Wrong "idees fixes" in GR
entry.summary: Six wrong idees fixes concerning the black holes and the gravitational waves.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.title: Why p=gamma(v)mv instead of p=mv? Because of the relativistic postulate
entry.summary: It is shown that the addition law of relativistic velocities leads to the fundamental equations of relativistic dynamics.

entry.title: Two problems in Classical Mechanics
entry.summary: A problem about the present structure of dimensional analysis, and another one about the differences between solids and fluids are suggested. Both problems appear to have certain foundational aspects.

entry.title: Critical dimension of Spectral Triples
entry.summary: It is open the possibility of imposing requisites to the quantisation of Connes' Spectral Triples in such a way that a critical dimension D=26 appears.

author.name: Alejandro Rivero
author.arxiv:affiliation: Univ de Zaragoza

entry.title: On the Quantum Aspects of Geophysics
Comments on "Finsler Geometry and Relativistic Field Theory"
entry.summary: We show that results obtained in paper Foundations of Physics 33, No. 7, 1107 (2003), are not correct.

entry.title: Is 'superstatistics' really 'super'?
entry.summary: Attention is drawn to problems associated with superstatistics, including the apparent lack of knowledge of previous work in statistical physics displayed by workers in this supposedly new field.

entry.title: Fuzzy Spacetime Issues
entry.summary: We argue that the Path Integral formulation of Feynman can be reconciled via a Planck scale underpinning for spacetime, with fuzzy spacetime considerations.

entry.title: Relativistic velocity transformation as a genitor of transformation equations (relativistic dynamics)
entry.summary: The fundamental equations of relativistic dynamics are derived from a thought experiment and from the transformation of relativistic velocity avoiding collisions and conservation laws of momentum and energy.

entry.title: The onefold truth
entry.summary: Some features of the Schwarzschild and Kruskal metric are being discussed under the assumption that the Schwarzschild model can be explained geometrically.

entry.title: Momentum Dependent Fundamental Action
entry.summary: The fundamental action is dependent on momentum. Some consequences are presented for matter waves and scalar quantum field theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: Revision of manuscript to appear in "Physics Essays" September 2005

entry.title: Motion backwards in time? A first example
entry.summary: An "anorthodox" explanation of the recently discovered (1998) "acceleration" of the Universe is proposed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Five pages with one figurre. Written in September 2001

entry.title: Polar coordinates, special relativity and CAS
entry.summary: We investigate the conditions under which computer programs represent correctly, in polar coordinates, the relativistic transformation equations for the space-time coordinates of the same event.

entry.title: Universe creation on a computer
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to provide an account of the epistemology and metaphysics of universe creation on a computer.

entry.title: Special relativity with clock synchronization
entry.summary: We present an introduction to special relativity kinematics stressing the part played by clocks synchronized following a procedure proposed by Einstein.

entry.title: Historical Background as an Essential Ingredient for the Understanding of New Developments in Quantum Mechanics
entry.summary: Paper is taken out with immediate effect.

entry.title: Comments on "Oriental magic mirrors and the Laplacian image"
entry.summary: We make some remarks on Berry's paper [{\it Eur. J. Phys.} 27 (2006) 109-118].

entry.title: Memetics of Quantum Mechanical Interpretations
entry.summary: The paper is taken out with immediate effect.

entry.title: Gravitational waves from BBH-systems? A (doubly) vain quest
entry.summary: The theoretical reasons at the root of LIGO's experimental failure in searching gravitational waves (GW's) from binary black hole (BBH) inspirals.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, LaTeX, to be published on Spacetime & Substance

entry.title: A faster than "World fastest derivation of the Lorentz transformation"
entry.summary: We show that a derivation of the Lorentz-Einstein transformation based on length contraction or on time dilation is faster then "World's fastest derivation of the Lorentz transformation"

entry.title: Hyper-Hamiltonian quantum mechanics
entry.summary: We present a modification of quantum mechanics with a *possible worlds* semantics. It is shown that `gauge' degrees of freedom along possible worlds can be used to encode gravitational information.

entry.title: Hypothesis of a Mundane Solution to the Pioneer Anomaly
entry.summary: Incorporating the relativistic all-angle Doppler shift equation in the interpretation of astronomical Doppler shift may help explain the Pioneer anomaly and other phenomena.

entry.title: Relativity and wavy motions
entry.summary: The conditions under which the undulatory character of field disturbances is physically significant.

entry.title: On Superstring and Supergravity Dimensions
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: Quantum Semiotics: A Sign Language for Quantum Mechanics
entry.summary: The article is taken out for change of contents with immediate effect.

entry.title: The Lorentz-Einstein length contraction is a real effect
entry.summary: An elementary thought experiment is used to show that once the time dilatation effect is established, there is no way to escape a dual length contraction.

entry.title: Definability in Physics
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn because the content has been substantially improved in a later paper, arXiv:0806.1165.

entry.title: On the equation of state in the hypertoroidal Universe
entry.summary: The author has withdrawn this submission.

entry.title: Machian Universe
entry.summary: We give arguments from the point of view of Gravitation as well as Electromagnetism which indicate a Machian view for the universe.

entry.title: The Clausius inequality does not follow from the second law of thermodynamics
entry.summary: The example of macroscopic thermodynamical system violating the Clausius inequality is presented.

entry.title: Fundamental neutrino experiments
entry.summary: We review fundamental open problems in neutrino physics and propose two basic experiments for their possible resolution.

entry.title: Preston on E=mc2
entry.summary: Samuel Preston's 1875 postulates concerning the nature ether are reviewed.

entry.title: Numerical Program for Computing $Φ^3$ Amplitudes
entry.summary: A computing program in Matlab is given that computes amplitudes in scalar $\phi^3$ theory. The program is partitioned into several parts and a simple guide is given for its use.

entry.title: Einstein, Levi-Civita, and Bianchi relations
entry.summary: About an essential suggestion to Einstein by Levi-Civita in 1915. Unicuique suum.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, LaTeX, to be published on Spacetime & Substance

entry.title: Some Unrecorded Science History. My Brush with Einstein's Relativistic Length Contraction
entry.summary: This paper is a short historical note about the origin of the Pole-Barn and the Fat Man Paradoxes

entry.title: Analytical Solution Describing the Periodicity of the Elements in the Periodic System
entry.summary: Mathematical formula describing the periodicity of the elements in the periodic system is presented.

entry.title: Galilean relativity, special relativity and the work-kinetic energy theorem revisited
entry.summary: Transformation equations for the kinetic energy of the same bullet in Galileo's and Einstein's special relativity are derived. The special relativity result is extended to the case of a photon.

entry.title: Invariance Mechanics - A new direction for quantum gravity
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: Double Boundary and Parity Doubling in Hadrons
entry.summary: A new mechanism for the parity doublers in hadrons is suggested.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 4 figures, to be submitted to Physics Letters B

entry.title: A critique of general relativity
entry.summary: General relativity's successes and limitations are compared to those of special relativity.

entry.title: NASA tests of Einstein's Universe call for non-empty space physics of nonlocal classical matter
entry.summary: LLR and GPB geodetic precessions have tested flatness for Einsten-Infeld-Hoffmann dynamics of distributed relativistic matter

entry.title: Dark Matter and Supersolidity
entry.summary: The origin of collisionless cold dark matter has been traced back to its origin to the supersolid model of quantum vacuum.

entry.title: Numerical Correpondences between the physical Constants
entry.summary: We present here a note which synthesizes our previous ideas concerning some problems in cosmology, and the numerical correspondences between the physical constants that we could deduce.

entry.title: Method of Forming Stable States of Dense High-Temperfature Plasma
entry.summary: Technology for forming stable states of dense high temperature plasma, which can be used, for example, for controlled thermo-nuclear synthesis.

entry.title: On Gravitational Motions
entry.summary: A new proof of the geodesic character of all motions of bodies that interact only gravitationally - and a detailed illustration of the real meaning of the linearized approximation of general relativity.

entry.title: Are we scoring calories correct?
entry.summary: A new method of food stuff energetic value scoring is offered

entry.title: Some thoughts on the fluid equation of cosmology
entry.summary: The well-known fluid equation of cosmology is examined with a view to elucidating the precise conditions under which it is applicable.

entry.title: On the attosecond laser pulse tissue interaction
entry.summary: In this paper the attosecond laser pulse tissue is investigated. The master equation is formulated and solved. The thermal relaxation time and thermal waves speed are calculated

entry.title: On the radial geodesics of Kerr's manifold
entry.summary: The so-called stationary-limit surface of Kerr's manifold represents an nsuperable barrier for the arriving material elements and light-rays.

entry.title: Black Holes and the LHC
entry.summary: The relevant physics for the possible formation of black holes in the LHC is discussed.

author.name: C Sivaram
author.arxiv:affiliation: Indian Institute of Astrophysics, Bangalore

entry.title: On nonlinear equations connected with six-dimensional Plebanski space
entry.summary: An examples of Monge-Ampere equations connected with six-dimensional generalization of the Plebanski four-dimensional space are considered. Their particular solutions are constructed.

entry.title: Dark energy of the Universe as a field of particles with spin 3
entry.summary: A hypothesis is presented for explanation of the dark matter and dark energy properties in terms of a new interaction field with spin 3.

entry.title: Searle's "Dualism Revisited"
entry.summary: A recent article in which John Searle claims to refute dualism is examined from a scientific perspective.

entry.title: Reissner exterior and interior
entry.summary: The Reissner-Nordstroem metric is re-examined and supplemented with an interior solution. Both metrics are embedded in a 5-dimensional flat space.

entry.title: Prospects for Quantum Computing
entry.summary: This note reviews prospects for quantum computing. It argues that gates need to be tested for a wide range of probability amplitudes.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, Presented at the CIFAR Nanotechnology program meeting, Halifax, Canada, November 14-16, 2008

entry.title: A counterexample against the Vlasov equation
entry.summary: A simple counterexample against the Vlasov equation is put forward, in which a magnetized plasma is perturbed by an electromagnetic standing wave.

entry.title: On Basics of Cosmology
entry.summary: Some discussion of physical and geometrical interpretation of Einsteins theory of gravitation which is on basic of cosmology.

entry.title: Examining the Wigner Distribution Using Dirac Notation
entry.summary: Expressing the Wigner distribution function in Dirac notation reveals its resemblance to a classical trajectory in phase space.

entry.title: On nonlinear equations associated with developable, ruled and minimal surfaces
entry.summary: An examples of solutions of nonlinear differential equations associated with developable, ruled and minimal surfaces are constructed.

entry.title: A Lagrangian for the quantionic field equation
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to present a Lagrangian from which we can derive the quantionic field equation written in the Dirac gauge using the principle of stationary action.

entry.title: Impossibility of a perpetuum mobile based on the nano-confinement effect on chemical equilibrium
entry.summary: Impossibility of a perpetuum mobile based on the nano-confinement effect on chemical equilibrium is considered.

entry.title: Is the Universe Rotating?
entry.summary: Numerous observations and studies suggest that the universe has some sort of overall rotation. We consider this matter and provide a new angle.

entry.title: Relations between elementary particle masses
entry.summary: Relations between elementary particles masses are given using only known physical constants, without any arbitrary number.

entry.title: Prospects of nuclear propulsion for space physics
entry.summary: A new kind of Nuclear rocket engine with very High specific impulse is presented
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Presented at the 2008 SIF Conference Genua Italy (former FERMILAB FN 824)

entry.title: All relativistic motions can be geodesically described
entry.summary: A suitable choice of the four components of the metric tensor which are at our discretion allows to represent geodesically also the non-gravitational motions.

entry.title: Geometrical joke(r?)s for SETI
entry.summary: Some historical data and geometrical representations about Stormer and Van-der-Pol long delayed echoes.

entry.title: Isotopetronics - new direction of nanoscience
entry.summary: Isotopetronics is a new branch of the nanoscience. This paper is briefly reviwed the main parts of isotopetronics.

entry.title: Towards Conscious Stochastic Systems
entry.summary: A modeling procedure for enhancing performance of stochastic systems is proposed.

entry.title: Gravitational collapses and Hilbertian repulsion
entry.summary: If we take into account the Hilbertian gravitational repulsion, even a dust sphere with a zero fluido-dynamical pressure collapses to a body of a comparatively small, finite, volume.

entry.title: Can gravity be added to Pilot Wave models?
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to come up with one of the many possible schemes of "adding" gravity to Pilot Wave models.

entry.title: Free-Oscillations Coincident with Earthquakes
entry.summary: Two de-modulation algorithms are used to observe free-oscillations of the earth that are coincident with earthquakes.

entry.title: Strict spatial flatness has been proved by the Aharonov-Bohm Effect
entry.summary: Would 3D space be non-Euclidean in physical reality then curved metric should destroy the Aharonov-Bohm Effect.

entry.title: Recent claims on trapping antihydrogen are premature, if not false
entry.summary: We prove why claims on trapping antihydrogen are premature, if not false.

entry.title: Renormdynamics, multiparticle production, negative binomial distribution and Riemann zeta function
entry.summary: Renormdynamic equations of motion and their solutions are given. New equation for NBD distribution and Riemann zeta function invented. Explicit forms of the z-Scaling functions are constructed.

entry.title: Perspective from Micro-Macro Duality -- Towards non-perturbative renormalization scheme
entry.summary: The problem of renormalization procedure is re-examined from the viewpoint of Micro-Macro duality.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk at the International Symposium, QBIC2008

entry.title: A Note on Parallel Transportation in Symmetric Teleparallel Geometry
entry.summary: I discuss autoparallel curves and geodesics in the symmetric teleparallel geometry.

entry.title: Topics on Hamiltonian Mechanics
entry.summary: We modify Hamiltonian mechanics. We reformulate the law of conservation of energy.

entry.title: Simple physical applications of a groupoid structure
entry.summary: Motivated by Quantum Mechanics considerations, we expose some cross product constructions on a groupoid structure. Furthermore, critical remarks are made on some basic formal aspects of the Hopf algebra structure.

entry.title: Interiors of SdS and RNdS Spacetime with Pressure and Cosmological Constant
entry.summary: We extend in this article the charged fluid with pressure derived by Bijalwan (2011a, 2011b) in presence of a cosmological constant.

entry.title: Stationary current of a viscous compressed liquid in a cylindrical pipe
entry.summary: An attempt of solving the equations of the movement of a newton's liquid in the cylindrical co-ordinates.

entry.title: Proof of a Lorentz and Levi-Civita thesis
entry.summary: A formal proof of the thesis by Lorentz and Levi-Civita that the left-hand side of Einstein field equations represents the real energy-momentum-stress tensor of the gravitational field.

entry.title: Berezovsky number
entry.summary: Berezovsky number is defined analogously to Erdos number. Berezovsky network is investigated.

entry.title: The Koide Lepton Mass Formula and Geometry of Circles
entry.summary: A remarkable formal similarity between Koide's Lepton mass formula and a generalized Descartes circle formula is reported.

entry.title: Ising Model and Z_2 Electrodynamics
entry.summary: The correlation functions and spontaneous magnetization are calculated for the three-dimensional Ising model and for the three-dimensional Z_2 electrodynamics.

entry.title: Bell's correlation for continuous local hidden causality is ambiguous
entry.summary: In this letter it is demonstrated that Bell's correlation can be ambiguous for continuously distributed local hidden variables.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Adv. Studies Theor. Phys., Vol. 6, 2012, no. 13, 643 - 647

entry.title: On the Ricci-flat metric for the Navier-Stokes equations
entry.summary: An examples of the Ricci-flat metric associated with the equations of Navier-Stokes are constructed. Their properties are investigated.

entry.title: Unification of Gravity with Electromagnetism
entry.summary: Principles of Maxwell, Lorentz, Milne, Dirac and Feynman are combined to unify gravity with electromagnetism.

entry.title: Quantum tunneling radiation from self-dual black holes
entry.summary: We calculate the Hawking temperature for a self-dual black hole in the context of quantum tunneling formalism.

entry.title: Remarks on Entanglement and Subjectivity
entry.summary: It is maintained that the phenomenon of entanglement, as presented by Bohm, admits, for every observation, a subjective interpretation which is free from action at a distance or superluminal transmission of information.

entry.title: Violation of Bell's inequality in fluid mechanics
entry.summary: We show that a classical fluid mechanical system can violate Bell's inequality because the fluid motion is correlated over large distances.

entry.title: Harmonic oscillators in a Snyder geometry
entry.summary: We find that, in presence of the Snyder geometry, the quantization of d isotropic harmonic oscillators can be solved exactly.

entry.title: Algebraic method for the harmonic oscillator with a minimal length
entry.summary: We show that the algebraic method solving the ordinary harmonic oscillator can be adapted to the non-commutative case.

entry.title: Derivation of the coefficient squared probability law in quantum mechanics
entry.summary: If one assumes there is probability of perception in quantum mechanics, then unitarity dictates that it must have the coefficient squared form, in agreement with experiment.

entry.title: Climate Change and Open Science
entry.summary: Obtaining reliable answers to the major scientific questions raised by climate change in time to take appropriate action gives added urgency to the open access program.

entry.title: Annotations regarding the Oxford Questions
entry.summary: The recently published "Oxford Questions" are supplemented with annotations concerning: doctrine of wave packets collapse (and sub- sidiarily Schrodinger's cat thought experiment), description of quan- tum measurements respectively interpretation of uncertainty relations.

entry.title: Methodological principles of modern thermodynamics
entry.summary: The article describes basic principles of the theory which unites thermodynamics of reversible and irreversible processes also extends them methods on processes of transfer and transformation of any forms of energy

entry.title: The April First Phenomenon
entry.summary: A true quantum reason for why people fib on April first.

entry.title: Comment on 'Single-slit electron diffraction with Aharonov-Bohm phase: Feynman's thought experiment with quantum point contacts'
entry.summary: We comment on the paper published in PRL 112, 010403 (2014).

entry.title: Effective quantum number for axially symmetric problems
entry.summary: We generalize the universal effective quantum number introduced earlier for centrally symmetric problems. The proposed number determines the semiclassical quantization condition for axially symmetric potentials.

entry.title: Fermi-Dirac function and energy gap
entry.summary: Medium field method is applied for studying valence electron behavior in metals. When different wave-vector electrons are attracted at low temperatures, distribution function gets discontinued. As a result, a specific energy gap occurs.

entry.title: On a fatal error in tachyonic physics
entry.summary: A fatal error in the famous paper on tachyons by Gerald Feinberg is pointed out. The correct expressions for energy and momentum of tachyons are derived.

entry.title: Nonperturbative quantization: ideas, perspectives, and applications
entry.summary: The procedure of nonperturbative quantization \`a la Heisenberg is considered. A few applications, features, perspectives, problems, and so on are considered. The comparison with turbulence modeling is performed.

entry.title: On the Quest for Standard Model Cold Dark Matter
entry.summary: The possibility that the relics of quark hadron phase transition in the microsecond old universe, the quark nuggets, may well be reasonable candidates for cold dark matter is critically examined.

entry.title: Measurement of the Spectra of Single Bubble Sonoluminescence in water
entry.summary: A preliminary results of measurement of the spectra of Single Bubble Sonoluminescence (SBSL) in water are presented. Analysis concentrates on similarity and differences of spectra from black-body radiation like shape.

entry.title: Black Holes Evaporate Non-Thermally
entry.summary: It is shown that the Hawking radiation and staying at the Schwarzschild state are not consistent for black holes as graviton balls. The only exception is the eternal black hole.

entry.title: Can Anyon statistics explain high temperature superconductivity?
entry.summary: In this paper, we find a reasonable explanation of high temperature superconductivity phenomena using Anyon statistics.

entry.title: A Study of Bianchi Type-I Cosmological Model With Cosmological Constant
entry.summary: We study Bianchi type-I space time with cosmological constant lambda using some conditions.

entry.title: Refractive index of dense materials
entry.summary: We show that applying the Lorentz-Lorenz transformation to the refractive index of metals, semiconductors and insulators allows for a less empirical modeling of this refractive index.

entry.title: Speculation On a Source of Dark Matter
entry.summary: By drawing an analogy with superfluid 4He vortices we suggest that dark matter may consist of irreducibly small remnants of cosmic strings.

entry.title: Unidirectionally shifted shadow arcs in La_{2-x}Sr_xCuO_4 explained
entry.summary: The observed faint shadow arcs, shifted unidirectionally from primary Fermi arcs, are caused by lattice distortion from edge dislocations introduced by cleaving the samples.

entry.title: Einstein's Violation of General Covariance
A solution of the measurement problem in quantum mechanics by using a variable hidden in Newtonian mechanics
entry.summary: The problem of a correct description of the physical phenomena of the Heisenberg uncertainty relation is solved by using a variable hidden in Newtonian mehcanics.

entry.title: Determination of the Fine Structure Constant by $π$
entry.summary: In the present report the author presents a simple and systematically defined formula for the fine structure constant based only on the number $\pi$. The difference between the suggested value and the currently known experimental one is about 60 times smaller than the uncertainty interval.

author.name: Anastass Anastasov
author.arxiv:affiliation: University of Sofia

entry.title: Differing Interactions Require Baryon and Lepton Conservation
entry.summary: Baryon and lepton numbers are conserved. Why? Baryon number must be because baryons are subject to strong interactions, leptons are not. Conservation of baryons leads to that of leptons. This raises further questions which are noted.

author.name: R. Mirman
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute for Group Theory and Applications

entry.title: The probability in the relativistic m+1 space-time
entry.summary: The probability behavior in the m+1 relativistic space-time is considered. The probability, which is defined by the relativistic m+1-vector of the probability density, is investigated.

entry.title: The physics space dimension
entry.summary: All fermions and all interactions between fermions are expressed by the Cayley numbers in our space-time. PACS 02.50.Cw 04.20.Cz 11.10.Kk 12.10.Dm

entry.title: Relativistic Effect of Velocity on Electric Charge and Lorentz Force
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn due to crucial errors.

author.name: K. C. Hwang
author.arxiv:affiliation: Irving, Texas

entry.title: Note on "Electromagnetism and Gravitation"
entry.summary: We obtain Hamilton equations for the gravitational field and demonstrate the conservation of total energy. We derive the Poisson bracket equation for a general dynamical variable.

entry.title: Neutrino Propulsion for Interstellar Spacecraft
entry.summary: An exotic spacecraft propulsion technology is described which exploits parity violation in weak interactions. Anisotropic neutrino emission from a polarized assembly of weakly interacting particles converts rest mass directly to spacecraft impulse.

author.name: J. A. Morgan
author.arxiv:affiliation: The Aerospace Corporation, CA, USA

entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to Acta Astronautica. 10 pages, one table

entry.title: Inertia as Emerging of a Hamiltonian Constraint System
entry.summary: The issue of inertia as opposition to acceleration of a massive point particle in Minkowski space-time is investigated in the context of a Hamiltonian constraint system. It is shown that the inertia as a locally-originating force in Minkowski space-time may emerge due to a global constraint.

entry.title: Which Physics Laws are Deduced from the Logic Properties of the Information?
entry.summary: The relativity theory principles and the quants theory principles are deduced from logic properties of the information, obtained from a physics device.

entry.title: Large Numbers, Galactic Rotation and Orbits
entry.summary: The time variation of the gravitational constant G in the recently discussed large number cosmologies accounts for the galactic rotational velocity curves without invoking dark matter and also for effects like the precession of the perhelion of Mercury.

entry.title: Quantum superluminal communication must exist
entry.summary: We show that the quantum superluminal communication based on the quantum nonlocal influence must exist if a basic principle of science is still valid, which states that if we have demonstrated the existence of something real, we can confirm its existence.

entry.title: The Unified Theory - Electricity, Magnetism, Gravity and Mechanics
entry.summary: This article shows the relations between the electricity, magnetism, gravity and mechanics by presenting an existing hidden structure in the Maxwell equations. This hidden structure allows to discover the classical physic from a new point of view leading to the unified theory (UT).

entry.title: Full Physical Derivation and Meaning of Lorentz Transformation
entry.summary: In the line of thought of Einstein's 1905 paper on relativity, I get a physical derivation of Lorentz transformation (LT) answering its main criticism and considerably enlarging the area of applications of the theory of relativity.

entry.title: The Bag Model of Nuclei
entry.summary: The basic assumptions and the general results of our bag model for nuclei are presented in detail. Nuclei are considered in a unified integration of the mean field theory and the MIT bag model

entry.title: Everyone can understand quantum mechanics
entry.summary: We show that everyone can understand quantum mechanics, only if he rejects the following prejudice, namely classical continuous motion (CCM) is the only possible and objective motion of particles.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, no figures, Comments are welcome

entry.title: Further Effects of Varying G
entry.summary: The correct perihelion precession was recently deduced within the frame work of a time varying Gravitational constant G. Here, we deduce also the observed gravitational bending of light and flattening of galactic rotational curves.

entry.title: Is it Possible to Transfer an Information with the Velocities Exceeding Speed of Light in Empty Space?
entry.summary: On the base of the theory of time and space with the fractional dimensions a possibility for information transferring with arbitrary velocities is demonstrated

entry.title: Post acceleraed Frames
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to similarity to the author's other paper
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to similarity to the author's other paper

entry.title: Comments on the Paper "On the Unification of the Fundamental Forces"
entry.summary: In this brief paper we justify observations made in El Naschie's paper "On the Unification of the Fundamental Forces...", on the Planck scale, fractal space time and the unification of interactions, from different standpoints.

entry.title: Deformed Lorentz Symmetry and High-Energy Astrophysics (I)
entry.summary: An updated discussion of Lorentz symmetry violation in particle physics at very high energy is presented, focusing on applications of models of deformed Lorentz symmetry to high-energy astrophysics.

author.name: Luis Gonzalez-Mestres
author.arxiv:affiliation: CNRS-IN2P3, France

entry.arxiv:comment: Updated version of a talk given at the ICRC 1999 Conference

entry.title: A Brief note on Fluctuations and Interactions
entry.summary: In this brief note we re-emphasize the fact that an underpinning of fluctuations characterizes the fundamental interactions in the light of El Naschie's recent work.

entry.title: Imprints of Discrete Space Time - A Brief Note
entry.summary: We point out that the observed decay mode of the pion and the Kaon decay puzzle are really imprints of discrete micro space-time.

entry.title: A Brief Note on Discrete Space Effects
entry.summary: We discuss briefly discrete space effects and show that this leads to space reflection asymmetry and also a minor modification of Einstein's energy-mass formula.

entry.title: The general relativistic theory of quasars
entry.summary: The paper was a preliminary and rejected by the author attempt to describe compact relativistic objects.

author.name: Zahid Zakir
author.arxiv:affiliation: CTPA

entry.arxiv:comment: A consistent treatment see in arXiv:0705.2585

entry.title: Black Holes From Different Perspectives
entry.summary: In this paper we consider black holes from a non general relativistic perspective as also from a microphysical point of view.

entry.title: It is the ambiguity. (But only three generations)
entry.summary: It is suggested that generations are linked to the need of calculating curvature of space via a deformed or discrete calculus. Quantization would limit the deformation, building three generations, and not four, as other interpretation could imply.

author.name: A. Rivero
author.arxiv:affiliation: Univ. Carlos III Madrid, Dep. Economia

entry.title: Explanation of Faraday's Experiment by the Time-Space Model of Wave Propagation
entry.summary: It is shown by the means of Time-Space Model of Wave Propagation the underlying phenomena of the alternating current's origin in famous Faraday's experiment.
entry.arxiv:comment: Written in Microsoft Word, 5 pages, 1 figure

entry.title: A simple unbreakable code
entry.summary: A simple unbreakable cipher system is presented which uses the concept of "pseudo-bits" that has never been used in either classical or quantum cryptography.

entry.title: Very promising hole in Bell's theorem
entry.summary: Through the hole in Bell's theorem we can communicate with matter
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages including 1 photo, 3 figures and 4 references. It was submitted as poster for the conference in commemoration of John S. Bell "Quantum [Un]speakables", Vienna 10-14 Nov. 2000

entry.title: On the Nature of the Energy Current in Many-Particle Systems
entry.summary: We show that the definition of an energy current for non-relativistic systems with action-at-a-distance is possible if the interaction respects Gausses law, i.e. if it is Coulomb-like. The energy current can transport kinetic and mass (excitation) energy but not potential energy.

entry.title: Twenty-Seven Lines on a Cubic Surface and Heterotic String Spacetimes
entry.summary: It is hypothetized that the algebra of the configuration of twenty-seven lines lying on a general cubic surface underlines the dimensional hierarchy of heterotic string spacetimes.

entry.title: The Elusive Monopole
entry.summary: In this brief note, we argue that the elusive magnetic monopole arises due to the strong magnetic effects arising from the non commutative space time structure at small scales. This would also explain why the monopole has eluded detection even after seventy years.

entry.title: Consequences of a Quantized Spacetime Model
entry.summary: A recent extended particle model is discussed, which lead to some interesting consequences in cosmology, neutrino astrophysics and low dimensional and low temperature statistics, some of which have since been verified.

entry.title: On the beams of wavy metric tensors
entry.summary: If we move at the same speed of a spatially limited train of an undulating metric tensor, a famous Serini's theorem will assure us that this train represents actually a flat spacetime region.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.title: Quantum Mechanical Description of Fluid Dynamics
entry.summary: In this paper, we deal with fluid motion in terms of quantum mechanics. Mechanism accounting for the appearance of quantum behavior is discussed.

entry.title: Quantization of Chaos for Particle Motion
entry.summary: We propose a formalism which makes the chaos to be quantized. Quantum mechanical equation is derived for describing the chaos for a particle moving in an electromagnetic field.

entry.title: Regular solutions of Schwarzschild problem
entry.summary: Through an analysis and a generalization of a profound Fock's treatment, I make conspicuous the physically essential role of those functions of the polar radial coordinate for which the expressions of the spacetime interval are everywhere regular for all values of the above coordinate.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.title: Wheeler-Feynman Absorber Theory Viewed by Model of Expansive Nondecelerative Universe
entry.summary: The present contribution documents the harmony of postulates and conclusions of Wheeler-Feynman absorber theory and the model of Expansive Nondecelerative Universe. A relationship connecting advanced electromagnetic waves and gravitational field quanta is rationalized.

entry.title: Four-dimensional Matter
entry.summary: Four-dimensional mass is determined in four-dimensional pseudo-Euclidean space as a physical invariant of that space. That invariant is discussed as an invariant of electromagnetic type. Finally, equations of Maxwell type are obtained for mass fields.

entry.title: A Longshot Technique for Resurrecting the Dead by Reversing the Flow of Time
entry.summary: Reversing the flow of time between Casimir plates raises the question of whether or not a recently deceased, intact organism could be brought back to life. The odds are not good.

entry.title: Non Commutativity, Fluctuations and Unification
entry.summary: We point out that in the non commutativity and breakdown of conventional spacetime at micro scales lies the seed to the unification of gravitation and electromagnetism.

entry.title: Radiation reaction 4-force: orthogonal or parallel to the 4-velocity?
entry.summary: In this note we point to some problems related to the standard derivation of the radiation reaction 4-force, and we propose a new expression for this 4-force, parallel to the 4-velocity.

entry.title: A Reconciliation of Electromagnetism and Gravitation
entry.summary: It is argued that once we consider the underpinning of a Non Commutative geometry, itself symptomatic of extended particles, for example in Quantum Superstring theory, then a reconciliation between gravitation and electromagnetism is possible.

entry.title: Some simple physical facts about the collapse of the Twin Towers
entry.summary: An analysis of the collapse of the Twin Towers is carried on with the aid of simple mechanical laws. The motion of the collapse front is calculated in terms of geometric and energetic quantities.

entry.title: A Piece of the Lepton Theory from a Probability
entry.summary: A masses of a leptons deduced from a representation of a probability density vector by a spinors. A massive W and Z bosons and a massless A boson are obtained from a transformations for which a density vector is invariant.

entry.title: A New Spin on the Dirac Electron
entry.summary: We re-examine the non Hermitian position coordinate of Dirac's equation, in the light of his own insights and conclude that this, and the Dirac equation itself is symptomatic of an underlying Noncommutative Geometry.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, TeX, Invited submission to the journal Electromagnetic Phenomena

entry.title: Un nouveau regard sur le monde physique
entry.summary: Dans ce colloque je discute la notion d'espace selon Descartes et Leibniz et j'y oppose le point de vue de Samuel Clarke et Isaac Newton comme solution pour comprendre la r\'ealit\'e du monde physique

entry.title: Theory of gravitation in flat space with no infinities
entry.summary: A theory of gravitation is presented. This theory does not relate gravitation to curvature of space-time. It explains the three standard results of general relativity in agreement with observations and suggests new experiments.

author.name: Irshadullah Khan
author.arxiv:affiliation: National Center for Physics, Quaid Azam University, Islamabad

entry.title: General Relativity Requires Absolute Space and Time
entry.summary: We examine two far-reaching and somewhat heretic consequences of General Relativity. (i) It requires a cosmology which includes a preferred rest frame, absolute space and time. (ii) A rotating universe and time travel are strict solutions of General Relativity.

entry.title: Non-Commutative Geometry, Spin and Quarks
entry.summary: In this paper we use considerations of non-commutative geometry to deduce a model for QCD interactions. The model also explains within the same theoretical framework hitherto purely phenomenological characteristics of the quarks like their fractional charge, mass,handedness and confinement.

entry.title: On the possibility of supercavitation in the quantum ether
entry.summary: In this speculative note some of the conceivable options of supercavitation in the vacuum of quantized field theory are discussed. The resulting modes of propagation could in principle be faster than the velocity of light in unbounded space-time.

entry.title: Constant-Force-Magnitude Chaotic Oscillator
entry.summary: A numerical model is presented for a mechanical oscillator in which the magnitude of the restoring force is constant. Unlike the harmonic oscillator, where force is proportional to displacement, this nonlinear system can be chaotic when externally driven.

entry.title: The mathematical features of the continuity equation
entry.summary: The conditions under which, the continuity equation can be substituted by an ordinary non differential equation, will be discussed. Since continuity equation is a fundamental equation, this result will be applicable in a vast area of Physics.

entry.title: A Few Exactly Solvable Models For Riccati Type Equations
entry.summary: We consider the Ricatti equation in the context of population dynamics, quantum scattering and a more general context. We examine some exactly solvable cases of real life interest.

author.name: B G Sidharth
author.arxiv:affiliation: Center For Applicable Mathematics and Computer Sciences

author.name: B S Lakshmi
author.arxiv:affiliation: Center For Applicable Mathematics and Computer Sciences

entry.title: Remarks on the Compatibility of Opposite Arrows of Time
entry.summary: I argue that opposite arrows of time, while being logically possible, cannot realistically be assumed to exist during one and the same epoch of this universe.

entry.title: Vacuum condensates and `ether-drift' experiments
entry.summary: The idea of a `condensed' vacuum state is generally accepted in modern elementary particle physics. We argue that this should motivate a new generation of precise `ether-drift' experiments with present-day technology.

entry.title: Realization logical operation on base of the quantum neuron
entry.summary: Two possible realizations of the formal neuron are considered as quantum system. The first type complies with classical system. The second type vastly increases the possible problems.

entry.title: "Quantum gravity": an oxymoron
entry.summary: I prove that "quantum" and "Einsteinian gravity" are incompatible concepts. Accordingly, the graviton is a mere object of science fiction.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, LaTeX, to be published on Spacetime & Substance

entry.title: A Model for Long Term Climate Change
entry.summary: In this paper we consider the well-known cyclical model for climate change, for example from glaciation to the present day and back, and compare this with a two-state model in Quantum Mechanics. We establish the full correspondence.

entry.title: On Dirac's magnetic monopole
entry.summary: The electric charge of the quantization condition of Dirac's monopole may have any value, we are not obliged to identify it with the electron charge. Consequently the magnetic charge of the monopole is quite arbitrary: Dirac's monopole is a mere object of science fiction.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.title: On Michell-Laplace dark body
entry.summary: The dark body of Michell-Laplace has nothing to do with the relativistic black hole.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, LaTeX, corrected Mitchell into Michell in title and abstract

entry.title: A double potential model for neutron halo nuclei
entry.summary: It is shown here that loosely bound halo structure of neutron rich nuclei and the ground state spin of single neutron halo nuclei are correlated and are consistently explained if one assumes a double potential shell model for these nuclei.

entry.title: The beginning of the Universe
entry.summary: In this brief essay we consider the concept of beginning in cosmology. It can be applied to the Universe as a whole, as well as to various epochs in the cosmic history and major structures as we can see them today.

entry.title: Protoplanetary Migration and Creation of Scattered Planetismal Disks
entry.summary: The relationship between protoplanet migration and the formation of the Kuiper Belt (planetesimal disk scattering) is examined.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, Lunar and Planetary Science XXXIII (2002)

entry.title: "An analysis of the classical Doppler Effect"[1] revisited
entry.summary: After having shown that the formula which describes the Doppler effect in the general case holds only in the case of the "very high" frequency assumption, we derive free of assumptions Doppler formulas for two scenarios presented in the revisited paper.

entry.title: The non-Abelian state-dependent gauge field in optics
entry.summary: The covariant formulation of the quantum dynamics in CP(1) should lead to the observable geometrodynamical effects for the local dynamical variable of the light polarization states.

entry.title: Postulated Mesoscale Quantum of Internal Friction Hysteresis
entry.summary: Evidence is provided, from yet another experiment, for the existence of a mesoscale quantum of internal friction hysteresis, having the value of the electron rest energy divided by the fine structure constant.

entry.title: Hadron thermodynamics, concavity and negative heat capacities
entry.summary: Problems associated with the nonextensivity of a hadron gas were discussed some time ago. Recently the topic has come to light again and here earlier results are re-examined in the light of new knowledge and attention is drawn to problems with the more modern work.

entry.title: Some comments on the universal constants
entry.summary: Recent references to the commonly accepted expression for the entropy of a black hole to questions concerning the constancy of some of the so-called 'universal constants of nature' are questioned, as is the validity of the said entropy expression.

entry.title: Special Relativity as a Physical Theory
entry.summary: A modest aim of this pedagogical presentation is to analyze, critically, certain fundamental physical concepts to illustrate the physical principles behind the special theory of relativity and, hence, to also illustrate the limitations of its applicability.
entry.arxiv:comment: Based on talk given. 18 pages, double column

entry.title: An immediate proof of the non-existence of GW's
entry.summary: In general relativity (GR) no observer is physically privileged. As a strict consequence, it can be shown that the physical generation of gravitational waves (GW's) is quite impossible.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, LaTeX, to be published on Spacetime & Substance

entry.title: On the dark energy
entry.summary: The dark energy problem may have a simple solution in the model of cosmology based on the space-time interaction hypothesis. The hypothesis throws light on the nature of time (see Time-Transcendence-Truth, to be published).

entry.title: Some comments on extreme value statistics
entry.summary: The question of whether extreme value statistics should be introduced into courses for physics students has been broached recently. Here it is argued that the topic should be taught but the many and varied physical applications should be stressed; emphasis should not be confined purely to abstract theory.

entry.title: Knots and Polytopes
entry.summary: A construction of polytopes is given based on integers. These geometries are constructed through a mapping to pure numbers and have multiple applications, including statistical mechanics and computer science. The number form is useful in topology and has a mapping to one-dimensional knot contours.

entry.title: Computational Derivation to Zeta Zeros and Prime Numbers
entry.summary: A route to the derivation of the numbers $s$ to the transcendental equation $\zeta(s)=0$ is presented. The solutions to this equation require the solving of a geodesic flow in an infinite dimensional manifold. These solutions enable one approach to a formula generating the prime numbers.

entry.title: On Friedmann's universes
entry.summary: There is a perfect concordance between Friedmann's cosmological models and the correspondent (purely gravitational interactions and negligible pressure) Newtonian models. This renders quite intuitive the fact that in general relativity no motion of bodies generates gravitational waves.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, LaTeX, to be published on Spacetime & Substance

entry.title: Self-field and magnetic-flux quantum mechanics
entry.summary: Self-field and quantized magnetic-flux are employed to generate the quantum numbers n, m, and l of atomic physics. Wave-particle duality is shown to be a natural outcome of having a particle and its self-field.

entry.title: On Serini's relativistic theorem
entry.summary: I expound here in a more detailed way a proof of an important Serini's theorem, which I have already sketched in a previous Note. Two related questions are briefly discussed.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, LaTex, to be published on Spacetime & Substance

entry.title: Special relativity in the electromagnetic wave
entry.summary: Invariance of the counted number of photons and the Lorentz-Einstein transformations enable us to derive transformation equations for the physical quantities introduced in order to characterize energy emission and transport in a plane and in a spherical electromagnetic wave propagating in vacuum.

entry.title: Quantum Gauge Theory Amplitude Solutions
entry.summary: The $n$-point amplitudes of gauge and gravity theory are given as a series in the coupling. The recursive derivative expansion is used to find all of the coupling coefficients. Initial conditions to any bare Lagrangian, or of an improved action, are used to compute quantum amplitudes.

entry.title: A Simple Hypothesis on the Origin and Physical Nature of Quantum Superposition of States
entry.summary: We suugest a simple hypothesis on physical origin of quantum superposition, which is a generalization of our "hidden time" hypothesis, suggested before.

author.name: Pavel V. Kurakin
author.arxiv:affiliation: Keldysh Institute of Applied Mathematics, Russian Academy of Sciences

author.name: George G. Malinetskii
author.arxiv:affiliation: Keldysh Institute of Applied Mathematics, Russian Academy of Sciences

entry.title: Relativistic velocity transformation as a genitor of transformation equations (electrodynamics)
entry.summary: We show that invariance of the electric charge and relativistic kinematics lead to the transformation equations for electric field intensity and the magnetic induction.

entry.title: Substance-like physical quantities in special relativity
entry.summary: Handling substance-like physical quantities in the limits of special relativity theory we should make a net distinction between those which present a proper (rest) magnitude and those which have not. We show how the theory relates them via relativistic transformation equations.

entry.title: The theory of pinch-effect in the concept scalar-vector potential
entry.summary: In the paper, on the basis of a new concept of the scalar-vector potential introduced by the author, mechanisms resulting in the plasma pinching are considered.

entry.title: Derivation of transformation equations for the parameters that characterize a plane acoustic wave without using phase invariance and Lorentz-Einstein transformation
entry.summary: We show that the transformation equations for the parameters that characterize a plane acoustic wave: period, (frequency), wave vector, wave length and phase velocity can be derived without using phase invariance and Lorentz-Einstein transformation

entry.title: Can we implement this quantum communication ?
entry.summary: Here I design an experimental way of a quantum communication by quantum CNOT gates and single qubit gates without the help of classical communication.

entry.title: Length measurement of a moving rod by a single observer without assumptions concerning its magnitude
entry.summary: We extend the results presented by Weinstein concerning the measurement of the length of a moving rod by a single observer, without making assumptions concerning the distance between the moving rod and the observer who measures its length.

entry.title: A Note on Singularities and Polynomial Zeros
entry.summary: The analysis of solutions to algebraic equations is further simplified. A couple of functions and their analytic continuation or root findings are required.

entry.title: A possible approach to relativistic thermodynamics
entry.summary: Considering a system of non-interacting particles characterized by the number N of its constituents and by its Kelvin temperature T, we reduce the transformation of the Kelvin temperature to the transformation mass

entry.title: Comment on "Roentgen quantum phase shift: a semiclassical local electrodynamical effect?"
entry.summary: In this short note we amplify our comments on the paper PRL 95,010405 (2005).
entry.arxiv:comment: Expanded version of the comment submitted to PRL

entry.title: The cosmic quanta paradigm fulfils the relativistic mechanics, improves the gravitation theory and originates the nuclear forces
entry.summary: Changing an obsolet physical paradigm, such as the gravitational mass, consents to explain the inertia-gravitation phenomena and the origin of the nuclear forces.

entry.title: A thermodynamic cycle more efficient than an infinite set of carnot engines operating between the same temperature levels
entry.summary: A theoretical thermodynamic cycle more efficient than an infinite set of Carnot engines is presented. This result is unexpected from the point of view of classical thermodynamics.

entry.title: An " Instrumentalism to Realism " Hypothesis
entry.summary: It is proposed here that all successful and complete theories always proceed through an intermediate stage of instrumentalism to the final stage of realism. Examples from history of science (both classical and modern) in support of this hypothesis are presented.

entry.title: Quantum Mechanics and Black Holes
entry.summary: This paper discusses the existence of black holes from the foundations of quantum mechanics. It is found that quantum mechanics rule out a possible gravitational collapse.

entry.title: Emergence of Spacetime
entry.summary: Starting from a background Zero Point Field (or Dark Energy) we show how an array of oscillators at the Planck scale leads to the formation of elementary particles and spacetime and also to a cosmology consistent with latest observations.

entry.title: Data Compression with Prime Numbers
entry.summary: A compression algorithm is presented that uses the set of prime numbers. Sequences of numbers are correlated with the prime numbers, and labeled with the integers. The algorithm can be iterated on data sets, generating factors of doubles on the compression.

entry.title: On rate of Universe expansion
entry.summary: It is offered another method how to describe contemporary stage of the Universe evolution. The method is based upon classical Einstein equations without a dark energy and other hypothetical fields.

author.name: Lennur Ya. Arifov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Simferopol, Ukraine

entry.title: Theories of Physics and Impossibilities
entry.summary: The role of impossibilities in theories of Physics is mentioned and a recent result is recalled in which Quantum Mechanics is characterized by three information-theoretic impossibilities. The inconvenience of the asymmetries established by such impossibilities is pointed out.

entry.title: Strings and Planck Oscillators
entry.summary: We contrast two theories which both start in one dimension at the Planck scale, viz., Quantum SuperString or M-Theory and a theory of Planck oscillations
entry.arxiv:comment: 24 pages.Based on two Chapters of "Universe of Fluctuations", Springer, NL, 2005

entry.title: On the gravitational collapse of a massive star
entry.summary: The celebrated treatment of continued gravitational collapse by Oppenheimer and Snyder is revisited and emended from some inherent flaws. The star contracts itself into a material point, not into a black hole.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, LaTex, to be published on Spacetime & Substance

entry.title: Unified field theories and Einstein
entry.summary: Einstein's contribution to relativity is reviewed. It is pointed out that Weyl gave first unified theory of gravitation and electromagnetism and it was different than the five dimensional theory of Kaluza. Einstein began his work on unification in 1925 that continued whole through the rest of his life.

entry.title: Possible Solution to the Poincare Conjecture
entry.summary: The Poincare conjecture is analyzed in the context of Calabi-Yau $n$-folds. A simple treatment is given by embedding the three-manifolds into these CY manifolds, and then taking the orbifold limit. The higher-dimensional proofs are also available in this context.

entry.title: Illustrating delta(E)=c^2 delta(m)
entry.summary: We present a thought experiment that involves a high sensitivity balance initially in a state of mechanical equilibrium but not in a state of thermal equilibrium. After reaching the state of thermal equilibrium it is no longer in a state of mechanical equilibrium.

entry.title: On the question of the asymmetry between matter and antimatter
entry.summary: In this article the lack of equilibrium between matter and antimatter is elucidated. Heisenberg uncertainty principle is a crucial ingredient to understand this disproportion.

entry.title: On calculation of elementary particles' masses
entry.summary: The purpose of present paper is to develop the approach to calculation of the mass spectra of elementary particles within the framework of the resonance theory of elementary particles as de Broglie waves

entry.title: Quantum mechanism of Biological Search
entry.summary: We wish to suggest an algorithm for biological search including DNA search. Our argument supposes that biological search be performed by quantum search.If we assume this, we can naturally answer the following long lasting puzzles such that "Why does DNA use the helix structure?" and "How can the evolution in biological system occur?".

entry.title: On Special Cases of General Geometry: geometries with changing length of vectors
entry.summary: We find relations between quantities defining geometry and quantities defining the length of a curve in geometries underlying Electromagnetism and unified model of Electromagnetism and Gravitation. We show that the length of a vector changes along a curve in these geometries.

entry.title: No motions of bodies produce GW's
entry.summary: A close comparison between Maxwell field and Einstein field makes conceptually and immediately evident that in general relativity (GR) no motions of bodies can generate gravitational waves (GW's).
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, LaTeX, to be published on Spacetime & Substance

entry.title: Multiply Connected Universes
entry.summary: It is now generally believed that our observable universe is one amongst a very large number - may be $10^{500}$ - of parallel universes. Following the author's own model in this context, we argue that this conglomeration of universes defines a multiply connected super space.

entry.title: Compton-Energy Scale of Friction Quantization
entry.summary: Numerous different experiments by the author, approaching nearly two decades of study, point strongly toward the possibility that friction operates around a mesoscale quantum of energy having the value 11 pJ.

entry.title: To the question of identification of linear spectrum of gravitational emission as of an emission of the same level with electromagnetic
entry.summary: The article overviews the algorithm of identification of spectrum lines of gravitational emission of electron with expected emission intensity close to electromagnetic emission.

entry.title: Dual origin of E=mc2
entry.summary: The mass-energy relation E=mc2 has a dual origin, one grounded in the postulate of the existence of an aether made of "ultramondane particules" moving in space at the speed of light, c; the other, a consequence, first deduced by Henri Poincare, of John Poynting's electromagnetic Theorem.

entry.title: Comments on "Attainable conditions and exact invariant for the time-dependent harmonic oscillator"
entry.arxiv:comment: Comments for <J. Phys. A>; 2 Pages in total

entry.title: How Many Types of Thermodynamical Equilibrium are There: Relation to Information Theory and Holism
entry.summary: Major revision of the thermodynamics is made in order to provide rigorous fundament for functional diversity of holistic type. It turns out that the new approach ensures reproducibility of the information as well.

entry.title: Time invariance violation is a physical base of atomic Bloch oscillations in an optical lattice
entry.summary: The physical mechanism of phenomenon is explained as a result of inequality of forward and reversed processes in optics. The importance of experimental study of its invariance relation is discussed.

entry.title: Geometrical optics in general relativity
entry.summary: General relativity includes geometrical optics. This basic fact has relevant consequences that concern the physical meaning of the discontinuity surfaces propagated in the gravitational field - as it was first emphasized by Levi-Civita.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, LaTeX, to be published on Spacetime & Substance

entry.title: Fourier Diffusion and Special Relativity in Nanotechnology
entry.summary: In this paper the transport phenomena in On-Chip-Transmission Line are investigated . The transport equation are developed and solved. The near light speed phenomena in OCTL are investigated Key words: On-chip transmission line, transport phenomena, near light speed phenomena

entry.title: Leptons in Dirac Spin Networks
entry.summary: In large networks of Dirac spinors individual spinors show space-time properties relative to quasi-classical clusters of spinors. Three forms of relations between spinors and such clusters are identified. These constitute three families of particle-like configurations, with a mass spectrum in close agreement with the experimental lepton spectrum.

entry.title: On Possible Causes of Divergencies in Experimental Values of Gravitational Constant
entry.summary: It is shown that discrepancies in the experimental values of the gravitational constant might be caused by the temperature dependence of the gravitational force and inequality of the absolute temperatures of sample masses used in various gravitational experiments.

entry.title: Intuitive Proof of Black-Scholes Formula Based on Arbitrage and Properties of Lognormal Distribution
entry.summary: Presented is intuitive proof of Black-Scholes formula for European call options, which is based on arbitrage and properties of lognormal distribution. Paper can help students and non-mathematicians to better understand economic concepts behind one of the biggest achievements in modern financial theory.

entry.title: Gravitational collapses to bodies of a finite volume
entry.summary: We prove with an exact relativistic computation that the spherosymmetric gravitational collapses with a time-dependent pressure end in bodies with a small, but finite volume. Against a diffuse, wrong conviction.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, LaTeX, to be published on Spacetime & Substance

entry.title: Central universal force field to explain solar orbital radial acceleration and other universal phenomena
entry.summary: I investigate a repulsive central universal force field on the behavior of celestial objects. I show its negative tidal effect on the solar orbits as experienced by Pioneer spacecrafts. I explain several cosmological effects in light of this force.

entry.title: Cosmic Contact : To Be, or Not To Be Archimedean ?
entry.summary: This is a two part paper which discusses various issues of cosmic contact related to what so far appears to be a self-imposed censorship implied by the customary acceptance of the Archimedean assumption on space-time.

entry.title: How to create a universe
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is (i) to expound the specification of a universe, according to those parts of mathematical physics which have been experimentally and observationally verified in our own universe; and (ii) to expound the possible means of creating a universe in the laboratory.

entry.title: A discontinuity of the background explains the Pioneer anomaly
entry.summary: The Pioneer anomaly is explained very simply if we assume that somewhere between us and the aircraft, the scale factor has undergone a discrete jump from an expansion a(t) regime to a contraction 1/a(t) regime

entry.title: Fluctuation-Enhanced Sensing of Molecules with Biased Carbon Nanotubes, or Nanowires, and Adsorption-Desorption Fluctuations
entry.summary: A new nanoscale device for fluctuation-enhanced sensing is proposed.

entry.title: Reciprocal Symmetric and Origin of Quantum Statistics
entry.summary: Boltzmann's differential equation is replaced by the corresponding reciprocal symmetric finite difference equation. Finite difference translates discreteness of energy. Boltzmann's function, then, splits into two reciprocally related functions. One of them gives Planck's radiation relation and the other one gives the corresponding Fermi-Dirac relation.

entry.title: Joining inner space to outer space
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to demonstrate that it is possible, in principle, to obtain knowledge of the entire universe at the present time, even if the radius of the universe is much larger than the radius of the observable universe.

entry.title: General Doppler Shift Equation and the Possibility of Systematic Error in Calculation of Z for High Redshift Type Ia Supernovae
entry.summary: Systematic error in calculation of z for high redshift type Ia supernovae could help explain unexpected luminosity values that indicate an accelerating rate of expansion of the universe.

entry.title: The Heaviside equation for laser heating of the fullerennes
entry.summary: In his paper the heating of the fullerenes by ultra-short laser pulses is investigated. The thermal Heaviside equation is formulated and solved for the Cauchy initial condition The effective thermal relaxation time is calculated.. Key words: fullerenes, Heaviside thermal equation, effective thermal relaxation time.

entry.title: Local quantum mechanics with finite Planck mass
entry.summary: In this paper the motion of quantum particles with initial mass m is investigated. The quantum mechanics equation is formulated and solved. It is shown that the wave function contains the component which is depended on the gravitation fine structure constant

entry.title: Nontrivial quantum effects in biology: A skeptical physicists' view
entry.summary: Invited contribution to "Quantum Aspects of Life", D. Abbott Ed. (World Scientific, Singapore, 2007).

entry.title: On the possible void decay in free-electron laser sase-fel experiment
entry.summary: In this paper the motion of ultrahigh energy particles produced in sasefel is investigated. The critical field which opose the acceleration of the ultra high energy particles is calculated

entry.title: Bell's Theorem refuted with a Kolmogorovian counterexample
entry.summary: The statistics behind Bell's inequality is demonstrated to allow a Kolmogorovian (i.e. classical) model of probabilities that recovers the quantum covariance.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Int J Theoretical Phys, Grp Theor & Nonl Optics 12(3), p215-228, 2008 (NOVA)

entry.title: Concept of a thermonuclear reactor based on gravity retention of high-temperature plasma
entry.summary: In the present paper the realization of the obtained results in relation to the dense high- temperature plasma of multivalent ions including experimental data interpretation is discussed.

entry.title: Emergence of time and Observable physics
entry.summary: This is a philosophy paper rather than mathematical physics work. I will publish it in some other place.

entry.title: On spherically symmetric structures in GR
entry.summary: We reconsider some subtle points concerning the relativistic treatment of the gravitational fields generated by spherically symmetric structures.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 1 figure, typing correction at page 8

entry.title: On the Clausius theorem
