entry.summary: We show that for a metastable system there exists a theoretical possibility of a violation of the Clausius inequality without a violation of the second law. Possibilities of experimental detection of this hypothetical violation are pointed out.

entry.title: Gauge invariance and time symmetry breaking
entry.summary: Employing an arbitrary velocity gauge transformation this contribution argues that the breaking of time symmetry is a natural consequence of irreversibility.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 3 figures; Seminar in Workshop Godel: Logic and Time,CBPF,2007, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

entry.title: GW's towards fundamental principles of GR
entry.summary: The physical non-existence of gravitational waves (GW's) as a consequence of the non-existence in general relativity (GR) of physically privileged reference frames, and of the ``plasticity'' of relativistic notion of a coordinate system.

entry.title: Lorentz transformation directly from the invariance of the speed of light via the addition law of parallel speeds
entry.summary: We show that starting with the addition law of parallel speeds derived as a consequence of the invariance of the speed of light, the Lorentz transformations for the space-time coordinates can be derived.

entry.title: The Astronomy and Science Behind the Myth
entry.summary: We show that many ancient Indian mythological legends are really allegorical depictions of astronomical and other physical phenomena of which the composers had a good idea. This detail enables us to also use techniques of astronomical chronology for dating various events.

entry.title: The Watch Paradox: Solution of the Problem
entry.summary: The article presents the detailed analysis of the watch paradox. It is shown that it arose because of unjustified, as it turned out, identification of watch readings at the moment of its return with the time read by it.

entry.title: Mathematical genesis ? Big Bang and Cantor set
entry.summary: A mathematical framework is proposed for the "big bang". It starts with some Cantor set and assumes the existence of a transformation from that set to the continuum set used in conventional physical theories like general relativity and quantum mechanics.

entry.title: Faster than Light Quantum Communication
entry.summary: Faster than light communication might be possible using the collapse of the quantum wave-function without any accompanying paradoxes.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 2 figures; added material on the collapse of the wave-function

entry.title: On the invariant thermal Proca - Klein - Gordon equation
entry.summary: In this paper we discuss the invariant thermal Proca - Klein - Gordon equation (PKG). We argue that for the thermal PKG equation the absolute velocity is equal v = alpha*c, where alpha is the fine stucture constant for electromagnetic interaction.

entry.title: On the Nature of Dark Matter and Dark Energy
entry.summary: It is shown that some problems connected with dark matter and dark energy can be solved in the framework of the byuon theory

entry.title: On repulsive gravitational actions
entry.summary: In particular instances and in particular regions the Einsteinian gravity exerts a repulsive action -- and without any cosmological term. This fact could have an interest for the explanation of the dark energy, and for the gravitational collapses.

entry.title: Data Transmission in the Fourth Dimension
entry.summary: Alice wants to send an arbitrary binary word to Bob. We show here that there is no problem for her to do that with only two bits. Of course, we consider here information like a signal in 4D.

entry.title: On the phase dependence of a reversed quantum transitions
entry.summary: Physical nature of widely known Ramsey fringes phenomenon is discussed.

entry.title: The Conception of Atom in Greek and Indian Physics
entry.summary: This paper contrasts the Greek and Indian conceptions of atom. It is shown that these two are quite different in spirit.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, Presented at the 17th International Conference on Vedanta, Miami University, Oxford. September 2007

entry.title: A Proof Of Kochen - Specker Theorem of Quantum Mechanics Using a Quantum Like Algebraic Formulation
entry.summary: Using a quantum like algebraic formulation we give proof of Kochen-Specker theorem. We introduce new criteria in order to account for the contextual nature of measurements in quantum mechanics.

entry.title: A scheme of supraluminal telegraph
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to the presented idea is wrong.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to the presented idea is wrong

entry.title: A New Approach to Special Relativity and The Universe
entry.summary: A new approach to special relativity is presented which introduces coordinate systems with imaginary time axes, observation systems, and coordinate bases.

entry.title: Testing for Subcellular Randomness
entry.summary: Statistical tests were conducted on 1,000 numbers generated from the genome of Bacteriophage T4, obtained from GenBank with accession number AF158101.The numbers passed the non-parametric, distribution-free tests.Deoxyribonucleic acid was discovered to be a random number generator, existent in nature.

entry.title: Reading the Electron Clock
entry.summary: If electron zitterbewegung is a real effect, it should generate an electric dipole field oscillating with the zitterbewegung frequency 2mc^2/hbar. The possibility of detecting it as a resonance in electron channeling is analyzed.

entry.title: Boundedness in Complex Systems: New Approach to Power Law Distributions
entry.summary: A new approach to complex systems aimed to resolve their paradoxes is proposed. Yet, the major inference is the prohibition of informational perpetuum mobile

entry.title: Interference Effects in the Brain
entry.summary: Interference effects are the most spectacular manifestation of the wave nature of phenomena. This note proposes a systematic search for such effects in the brain.

entry.title: Hilbertian Repulsive Effect and Dark Energy
entry.summary: A repulsive gravitational effect of general relativity (without cosmological term), which was pointed out by Hilbert many years ago, could play a decisive role in the explanation of the observational data concerning the accelerated expansion of the universe.

entry.title: Proca Equation for Attosecond Electron Pulses
entry.summary: In this paper the heat transport of attosecond electron pulses is investigated. It is shown that attosecond electrons can propagate as thermal waves or diffused as particle conglommerates, Proca equation as type equation for the thermal transport of the attosecond electron pulsem is formulated

entry.title: On the string solution in the SUSY - Skyrme model
entry.summary: In this paper, we have found the string solution in the SUSY Skyrme model. Moreover, the mechanics of decay of SUSY - string was discussed.

entry.title: Second sound in nuclear interaction
entry.summary: Following the method developed in monograph : From quarks to bulk matter Hadronic Press 2001the master equation for second sound in nuclear matter is obtained and solved. The velocity of second sound is calculated

entry.title: Time Travel and the Reality of Spontaneity
entry.summary: Contrary to the informed consensus, time travel implies spontaneity (as distinct from chance) so that time travel can only be of the second kind.

entry.title: ZPF, Zitterbewegung and Inertial Mass
entry.summary: In this paper, we argue that the background Zero Point Field, induces an oscillatory motion which we identify with zitterbewegung. We deduce that this is the origin of inertial mass

entry.title: Neutron Stars and Fractal Dimensionality
entry.summary: We argue that the material inside Neutron stars behaves anomalously with fractal statistics and that in principle, we could induce mini Neutron stars, with the release of energy.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Chaos, Solitons and Fractals

entry.title: Comment on "Interference in the Collective Electron Momentum in Double Photoionization of H2"
entry.summary: We give supporting evidence for and elaborate further on the fact -see Kreidi et al., Phys. Rev. Lett. 100, 133005 (2008)- that ionic states are essential for covalent dihydrogen H2.

entry.title: Fractional spin - a property of particles described with a fractional Schroedinger equation
entry.summary: It is shown, that the requirement of invariance under spatial rotations reveales an intrinsic fractional extended translation-rotation-like property for particles described with the fractional Schroedinger equation, which we call fractional spin.

entry.title: The Duality of the Universe
entry.summary: It is proposed that the physical universe is an instance of a mathematical structure which possesses a dual structure, and that this dual structure is the collection of all possible knowledge of the physical universe. In turn, the physical universe is then the dual space of the latter.

entry.title: Thermodynamics and Relativity: Possible Consequences of their Close Link
entry.summary: The first part of this paper is a summary of a hypothesis previously advanced, suggesting the existence of a close link between thermodynamics and relativity. The second part is a preliminary comment about some possible consequences in the fields of physics, astronomy and biology.

entry.title: Transformation of kinematical quantities from rotating into static coordinate system
entry.summary: In this article the problem for the using of uniformly rotating coordinate system is considered. The correct relations between the kinematical quantities characterizing the motion of a body relative to uniformly rotating system and static coordinate system are obtained.

entry.title: Klein - Gordon equation for market wealth operations
entry.summary: In this paper the modified Klein - Gordon equation for market processes is proposed and solved. It is argued that the oscillations in market propagate with the light velocity. The initial pulse in the market is damped and for very large time diffused according to the Fourier law.

entry.title: Dosimetry, scattering theory, and Monte Carlo simulation
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to provide an introduction to the physics of scattering theory, to define the dosimetric concept of linear energy transfer in terms of scattering theory, and to provide an introduction to the concepts underlying Monte Carlo simulations.

entry.title: Comment on "Spin and Orbital Angular Momentum in Gauge Theories: Nucleon Spin Structure and Multipole Radiation Revisited"
entry.summary: This is a comment on Chen et al Letter PRL,100, 232002 (2008).

entry.title: Faster than light communication : is it possible ?
entry.summary: A quantum optical apparatus permitting a faster than light communication between distant locations has been recently proposed by Shiekh. Some several conceptual difficulties concerning this proposal are briefly addressed.

entry.title: Cosmological Expansion Started from the Big Bounce on Local Rotation
entry.summary: The cosmological models in the frame of the Newtonian and general relativistic treatments are considered. The centrifugal forces acting between particles rotating randomly around each other are shown to be able to reverse gravitational collapse.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 1 PDF file, converted from Word file

entry.title: Quantum Destructive Interference
entry.summary: An apparent paradox for unitarity non-conservation is investigated for the case of destructive quantum interference.

entry.title: Quantum fields as gravitational sources
entry.summary: The practice of setting quantum fields as sources for classical general relativity is examined. Several conceptual problems are identified which invalidate apparently innocuous equations. Alternative ways to links classical general relativity with quantum theory using Bohm's theory are proposed.

entry.title: Surface fraction of random close packing in two dimensions calculated exactly
entry.summary: The random close packing fraction in two dimensions is calculated exactly via the central limit theorem and the brownian motion with no gain between monodisperse disks.

entry.title: Modelling Time
entry.summary: We briefly review two concepts of time - the usual time associated with "being" and more recent ideas, answering to the description of "becoming". The approximation involved in the former is examined. Finally we argue that it is (unpredictable) fluctuations that underlie time.

entry.title: Magnetic dipole moment of the electron
entry.summary: We present a model which determines the correct value of the magnetic dipole moment of the electron. By this, we find a physical meaning for the electron spin.

entry.title: Gravitational intraction on quantum level and consequences thereof
entry.summary: The notion of gravitational emission as an emission of the same level with electromagnetic emission is based on the proven fact of existence of electrons stationary states in its own gravitational field, characterized by gravitational constant

entry.title: Relativistic dynamics without collisions and conservation laws
entry.summary: We show that the relativistic expressions for momentum and energy as well as the way in which they transform could be derived without involving collisions and conservation laws. Our approach involves relativistic kinematics via the addition law of relativistic velocities.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to American Journal of Physics

entry.title: 25 years ago: the official farewell to the meter
entry.summary: On october 21st 1983 took place in S\`evres on the western outskirts of Paris the official funeral of the meter. With it the notion of distance as a physical observable was buried.

entry.title: Planck Oscillators and Elementary Particles
entry.summary: In this paper we argue that it is possible to model the Universe along thermodynamic lines, using oscillators in the background Dark Energy at the Planck scale. This leads to meaningful results in agreement with observation.

entry.title: Non-holonomic Constraints and the Principle of Extremal Curvature
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author(s)

entry.title: The Lorentz Condition is Equivalent to Maxwell Equations
entry.summary: It is shown that the Lorentz condition which is a conservation law on the electromagnetic four-vector-density A, plus the Lorentz transformation, taken together, are equivalent to the microscopic Maxwell's equations.

entry.title: Grete Hermann: An early contributor to quantum theory
entry.summary: The life and accomplishments of Grete Hermann are described. During the early twentieth century, she worked in physics, mathematics, philosophy and education. Her most notable accomplishments in physics were in the interpretation of quantum theory.

entry.title: Entropy oscillations
entry.summary: The opportunity of occurrence of entropy oscillations around of a stationary state in linear and nonlinear processes is theoretically shown. The new mechanism of global tendencies appearance is described.
entry.arxiv:comment: Keywords: Entropy, Entrostat, Entropy oscillations, Self-organization, Open systems, Global problems of mankind

entry.title: Classical counterexample to Bell's theorem
entry.summary: We describe a strictly classical dice game, which emulates the main features of the EPR experiment, including violation of Bell's inequalities. Therefore, the standard interpretation that Bell's theorem provides necessary conditions for `local realism' is disproved.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 1 figure. CHSH inequality violation included

entry.title: Quantum Interference: an experimental proposal, and possible Engineering applications
entry.summary: A proposal for an experiment to look at some possibly novel aspects of quantum interference is presented, along with some Engineering applications that might result.

entry.title: The Mechanics of the Systems of Structured Particles
entry.summary: The mechanics of the structured particles develops. The substantiation of applicability of such mechanics for the description of processes of evolution in open nonequilibrium systems is offered. The consequences following from the equations of dynamics of structured particles are analyzed.

entry.title: Note on "Anomalous Hydrodynamic Drafting of Interacting Flapping Flags"
entry.summary: We make remarks on Ristroph and Zhang's [{\it Phys. Rev. Lett.} 101, 194502 (2008)] paper.

entry.title: The Axis and the Perimeter of the Temple
entry.summary: This paper presents textual evidence for an astronomical basis of the dimensions of the axis and perimeter in the plan of the Indian temple.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 7 figures, Kannada Vrinda Seminar Sangama 2005 held at Loyola Marymount University in Los Angeles on November 19, 2005

entry.title: On the relation between Schwarzschild's and Kerr's manifolds
entry.summary: Kerr's manifold is only a Schwarzschild's manifold as seen by a suitably rotating coordinate system. By taking into account this fact, Kerr's manifold can be reduced to a Schwarzschild's manifold. In a final summary we give the main steps of our reasoning.

entry.title: Nonlinear Density Wave Theory and Evolutionary Direction of Spiral Galaxies
entry.summary: Based on the nonlinear equations of the density wave theory, the evolutionary direction and the observable conditions on spiral galaxies may be derived by the qualitative analysis theory.

entry.title: The polychromatic form of the Einstein photoelectric equation
entry.summary: We generalize the Einstein photoelectric equation for the case that the matter is irradiated by the polychromatic light of blackbody, or, by the synchrotron radiation. The work function of the collective motion of photoelectrons is discussed.

entry.title: Simplicissimus' Inquiries
entry.summary: This is a kind of essay dedicated to Lev Borisovich Okun. I would like to ask some questions which I can not answer. However I suspect I know how to answer them. Questions are as follows: 1. Particle identity. 2. Information storage. 3. Information read-out at the speed higher than that of light.

entry.title: Attraction and repulsion in spacetime of an electrically charged mass-point
entry.summary: By virtue of Hilbert repulsive effect, the most external singular surface of Reissner-Weyl-Nordstroem metric represents an insuperable barrier for the arriving neutral particles and light rays.

entry.title: An Introduction to Fluorescence Resonance Energy Transfer (FRET)
entry.summary: Recent advances in Fluorescence Resonance Energy Transfer (FRET) provides a way to measure and understand different biological systems and molecular interactions in nanometer order. In this report the introduction and principle of the FRET process have been explained.

entry.title: On some relativistic singular surfaces
entry.summary: In the current relativistic literature there are misleading considerations about some singular surfaces. An accurate geometric analysis allows to settle the question. No physical meaning is attributable to the spatial regions surrounded by the above surfaces. A recent observational paper by A. Fabian et al. is discussed in sect.4.

entry.title: Comment on 'Note on the dog-and-rabbit chase problem in introductory kinematics'
entry.summary: We comment on the recent paper by Yuan Qing-Xin and Du Yin-Xiao (Eur. J. Phys. 29 (2008) N43-N45).

entry.title: Quantum Jet Theory, Observer Dependence, and Multi-dimensional Virasoro algebra
entry.summary: We review some key features of Quantum Jet Theory: observer dependence, multi-dimensional Virasoro algebra, and the prediction that spacetime has four dimensions.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the Invertis Journal of Science and Technology. 10pp

entry.title: Relativity as classical limit in a combinatorial scenario
entry.summary: We discuss how the finiteness and universality of the speed of light arise in the theoretical framework introduced in [1], and derive generalized coordinate transformations, that allow to investigate physical systems in a non-classical regime.

entry.title: Multidimensional the Ricci-flat spaces defined by nonlinear equations
entry.summary: An examples of multidimensional the Ricci-flat spaces defined by nonlinear differential equations are constructed. Their properties are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, LaTex, Presented on the 5-th International Conference "Solitons, Collapses and Turbulence", Chernogolovka, 2-8 August 2009

entry.title: One-way speed of light?
entry.summary: This is a comment on a paper by Greaves, Rodriguez, and Ruiz-Camacho [Am. J. Phys. 77, 894 (2009)] which reports a measurement of the one-way speed of light.

author.name: J. Finkelstein
author.arxiv:affiliation: LBNL and Sjsu

entry.title: Protons do not exert any Hilbertian gravitational repulsion
entry.summary: The Hilbertian gravitational repulsion is quite absent in the Einsteinian field of a proton, owing to the gravitational action of its electric charge. Accordingly, the proton bunches of the LHC cannot exert any repulsive gravitational force.

entry.title: Testing Doppler type shift for an accelerated source and determination of the universal maximal acceleration
entry.summary: An experiment for testing Doppler type shift for an accelerated source and determination of the universal maximal acceleration is proposed.

entry.title: Schrodinger equation for classical particles
entry.summary: In this paper we propose the hyperbolic Schredinger equation (HS). The solution of the HS for a particle in a box is obtained. It is shown that for particles with m greater of Mp the energy spectrum is independent of the mass of particle.

entry.title: Comparison of Monte-Carlo and Einstein methods in the light-gas interactions
entry.summary: To study the propagation of light in nebulae, many astrophysicists use a Monte-Carlo computation which does not take interferences into account. Replacing the wrong method by Einstein coefficients theory gives, on an example, a theoretical spectrum much closer to the observed one.

entry.title: An Infinite Fractal Cosmos
entry.summary: The paradigmatic transition from a small finite universe to an infinite unbounded fractal cosmos is briefly put into historical context and discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, published in Journal of Cosmology, Vol. 4, 674-677

entry.title: Uniformly Loaded Rectangular Thin Plates with Symmetrical Boundary Conditions
entry.summary: In the article the Fourier series analytical solutions of uniformly loaded rectangular thin plates with symmetrical boundary conditions are considered. For all the cases the numerical values are tabulated.

entry.title: Deviation from secular equilibrium
entry.summary: Laser exposure of gold nanoparticles in aqueous solutions of Uranium salt leads to accelerated decay of U238 nuclei and significant deviation from secular equilibrium. The samples demonstrate the enhanced gamma emission in the range of 54 keV during laser exposure.

entry.title: Double-Slit Experiment and Quantum Theory Event-Probability Interpretation
entry.summary: In this article the propagation of pointlike event probabilities in space is considered. Double-Slit experiment is described in detail. New interpretation of Quantum Theory is formulated.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Book: G. Quznetsov, Probabilistic Treatment of Gauge Theories, Nova Sci. Publ., NY, 2007, pp.50-60

entry.title: The invariance of the speed of light
entry.summary: We show that the conclusion of a recent experiment [arXiv:0912.3934] that claims to have discovered that "the speed of light seems to depend on the motion of the observer" is wrong.

entry.title: Beyond Quantum Mechanics and General Relativity
entry.summary: In this note I present the main ideas of my proposal about the theoretical framework that could underlie, and therefore "unify", Quantum Mechanics and Relativity, and I briefly summarize the implications and predictions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, to appear in the "Invertis Journal of Science and Technology", New Dehli, 2010

entry.title: Archaeoastronomy in India
entry.summary: This paper is a review of archaeoastronomy in India.
entry.arxiv:comment: 19 pages. This article is the unabridged version of an essay written for the International Council on Monuments and Sites (ICOMOS) and the International Astronomical Union (IAU), 2010

entry.title: Energy and Mass Generation
entry.summary: Modifications in the energy momentum dispersion laws due to a noncommutative geometry, have been considered in recent years. We examine the oscillations of extended objects in this perspective and find that there is now a "generation" of energy.

entry.title: Lorentz contraction according to the wave nature of the light
entry.summary: The wave nature of the light, applied to the kinematics of the moving bodies, permits to investigate and find a coherent solution on some questions raised by the theory of special relativity about the Lorentz contraction.

entry.title: Comments on "Nonlinear Elastic Response in Solid Helium: Critical Velocity or Strain?"
entry.summary: We make comments on Day {\it et al.}'s [{\it Phys. Rev. Lett.} 104, 075302 (2010)] paper. Our focus is upon the hysteresis loop in Figure 3 of this paper which was not closed.

entry.title: Explaining the equality of inertia and gravitational mass
entry.summary: The equality of the inertia and the gravitational mass of a body is explained in a very general manner. We also motivate this explanation by providing analogous examples
entry.arxiv:comment: To Physics Community At Large: Comments would be most welcome

entry.title: Buffon Needle Problem Application to Space Exploration
entry.summary: In this article the possibility of application of classical Buffon needle problem to the investigation of orientation engine firing problem has been investigated. Such an approach makes it possible to get a reliable EP of this undesired event without using a more complicated analysis.

entry.title: Is the Universe the only existing Black Hole?
entry.summary: We investigate the physics of black holes in the light of the quantum theoretical framework proposed in [1]. It is argued that black holes are completely non-local objects, and that the only one which really exists is the universe itself.

entry.title: A Brief Introduction to Quantum Energy Teleportation
entry.summary: A new quantum protocol is introduced which attains energy transportation only by local operations and classical communication retaining all physical laws including local energy conservation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, no figure, for invitation to SciFoo 2010 at Google, Mountain View, CA, USA (Jul. 30 - Aug. 1, 2010)

entry.title: Einstein's Moon
entry.summary: An account of the subjective elements of quantum mechanics or of whether, as Einstein famously asked, the Moon exists when nobody is looking at it.

entry.title: Should the electric polarization of intrastellar plasma be taken into consideration at elaboration a star theory?
entry.summary: It is shown that the gravity-induced electric polarization of intrastellar plasma must be taken into consideration at formulation of a star theory, as plasma in the stars is electrically polarized.

entry.title: Bipolaron Model of the Superconductivity of an Iron-Based Layered Compound LnO_{1-x}F_xFePn (Ln =La, Sm, Nd, Pr, Ce, Pn=P, As)
entry.summary: A bipolaron model is proposed as a superconductivity mechanism for iron-based superconductivity. The results are consistent with the experiments.

entry.title: Models of the "Universe" and a Closure Principle
entry.summary: Partial descriptions of the Universe are presented in the form of linear equations considered in the free (full, super) Fock space. The universal properties of these equations are discussed. The closure problem caused by computational and experimental ability is considered and reduced to appropriate additional conditions imposed on solutions.

entry.title: Length contraction puzzle solved?
entry.summary: It is argued that the `perspectival change' of a physical object in special relativity may be given a natural dynamical explanation in terms of a change in the object under the action of certain forces in a rest properties-preserving way.

entry.title: Signal Peak-Tracker based on the Teager-Kaiser Energy (TKE) Operator
entry.summary: Described is a modification of the TKE operator from its usual `energy form'. The resulting `peak-tracker' (or peak-detector) is especially useful in studies that involve the frequency domain.

entry.title: Bipolaron Model of Superconductivity in Chalcogenide Glasses
entry.summary: In this paper we propose a small bipolaron model for the superconductivity in the Chalcogenide glasses (c-As2Te3 and c-GeTe). The results are agree with the experiments.

entry.title: Special Theory of Relativity without special assumptions and tachyonic motion
entry.summary: The most general form of transformations of spacetime coordinates in Special Theory of Relativity based solely on physical assumptions are described. Only the linearity of spacetime transformations and the constancy of the speed of light are used as assumptions. The application to tachyonic motion is indicated.

entry.title: Dynamical Implications of Adjustments to Proper Time Caused by Higher Dimensions: A Note
entry.summary: When the proper time of general relativity is adjusted to reflect the possible existence of higher dimensions, small dynamical effects appear in spacetime of the sort usually associated with the cosmological constant, Hubble's Law and Heisenberg's relation.

entry.title: Distribution of ranks of β-decay half-lives
entry.summary: I studied the distribution of ranks of values of 2949 {\beta}-decay half-lives according to an empirical beta law with two exponents. {\beta}-decay half-life ranks showed good fit to a beta function with two exponents.

entry.title: Smart-phone Sensor of Pendulum Motion
entry.summary: Described is an experiment where the embedded accelerometer of a smart-phone was used to study the free decay of a `simple' pendulum to which the phone was attached.

entry.title: CHSH and local hidden causality
entry.summary: Mathematics equivalent to Bell's derivation of the inequalities, also allows a local hidden variables explanation for the correlation between distant measurements.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Adv Studies Theor. Phys., Vol. 4, 2010, no. 20, 945 - 949

entry.title: Physics in discrete spaces (A): Space-Time organization
entry.summary: We put forward a model of discrete physical space that can account for the structure of space- time, give an interpretation to the postulates of quantum mechanics and provide a possible explanation to the organization of the standard model of particles.

entry.title: Quantum-Mechanical Waves in Closed Vacuum States
entry.summary: Campbell's theorem enables the embedding of 4D anti-deSitter space in 5D canonical space, so a particle becomes a wave in the extra dimension, running through spacetime. This model of wave-particle duality provides a new approach to particle mass.

entry.title: Comment On "On observation of neutron quantum states in the Earth's gravitational field"
entry.summary: It is shown that criticism in the paper: "On observation of neutron quantum states in the Earth's gravitational field." Phys.Rev.D {\bf 81} 052008 (2010) of the experiment with neutrons to observe bound levels in gravity field is not correct.

entry.title: Special light trajectories in optical medium
entry.summary: The Fermat principle is used to define trajectories in nonhomogenous optical media. The Poincare model of the Lobachevskii geometry is derived. The index of refraction is determined for the light confined in the circular trajectory in the optical medium.

entry.title: On the Velocity Tensors
entry.summary: A new object, called the velocity tensor, is introduced. It allows to formulate a generally covariant mechanics. Some properties of the velocity tensor are derived.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Physics of Atomic Nuclei, vol. 72, no. 5, 2009, 809-812

entry.title: Heavy Long-lived Mossbauer State of Niobium
entry.summary: A heavy niobium state showing 1/3 residual resistance is discovered below the superconducting transition temperature. This niobium sample contains high-density long-lived Mossbauer excitation.

entry.title: A quantum group for the Einstein's equations
entry.summary: In this paper, we expose the construction of a possible, simple quantum matrix group (according to Woronowicz), related to elementary formal aspects of the Einstein field equations of General Relativity, and its possible symmetries.

entry.title: Nonholonomic constrains: why does not the least action principle leads to equations describing the motion consistent with the physical behaviour?
entry.summary: The least action principle seems not to lead to equations describing the motion consistent with the physical behavior for nonholonomic constrains. Here an answer to this question in proposed.

entry.title: From Galilean Relativity to Quantum Gravity : Three Issues, c, h, G, concerning Time, Matter and Inertia
entry.summary: An odd look at "standard" physics (Galileo, Newton, Einstein, Dirac) leading to a radical change of our concept of inertial motion and to new heuristic approaches of gravitation and the cosmological constant.

entry.title: Astronomical Dating and the Internal Chronology of the Pentateuch
entry.summary: Some of the narratives in the Pentateuch can be associated with known astronomical events to provide absolute dates for biblical chronology.

entry.title: On the New Puzzling Results from MiniBooNE
entry.summary: We look into the recent puzzlng results from MiniBooNE and contrast their results with that from NOMAD. A pictuire which provides consistent decscriptiobn of both is discussed here. This also points to future directions in neutrino studies.

entry.title: Fractional Modified Special Relativity
entry.summary: Fractional calculus represents a natural tool for describing relativistic phenomena in pseudo-Euclidean space-time. In this study, Fractional modified special relativity is presented. We obtain fractional generalized relation for the time dilation.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Prespacetime Journal | August 2011 | Vol. 2 | Issue 8 | pp. 1264-1269

entry.title: Negative Energy Solutions and Symmetries
entry.summary: We revisit the negative energy solutions of the Dirac equation, which become relevant at very high energies and study several symmetries which follow therefrom. The consequences are briefly examined.

entry.title: Lambda- and Schottky-anomalies in solid-state phase transitions
entry.summary: The origin of lambda and Schottky anomalies in solid-state phase transitions are analyzed and illustrated. They are shown to be the latent heat of nucleation-and-growth phase transitions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Based on the material published in Fundamentals of Solid-State Phase Transitions, Ferromagnetism and Ferroelectricity, 2nd Ed., DirectScientific Press (2010)

entry.title: Spontaneous CP violation and CPT violation
entry.summary: At first we give a little formalism to show some features of spontaneous CP violation theory. Then we give a convincing argument show that Cronin etc's experiment is a evidence of CPT violation and spontaneous CP violation is absolutely necessary. Final we discuss some possible CPT violation mechanism.

entry.title: Fractal properties in fundamental force coupling constants, in atomic energies, and in elementary particle masses
entry.summary: Using the discrete-scale invariance theory, we show that the coupling constants of fundamental forces, the atomic masses and energies, and the elementary particle masses, obey to the fractal properties.

author.name: Boris Tatischeff
author.arxiv:affiliation: IPN-Orsay

entry.title: Rationale for METI
entry.summary: Transmission of the information into the Cosmos is treated as one of the pressing needs of an advanced civilization. The inability to meet this need, the forced withdrawal into self-imposed isolation can lead to the extinction of civilization.

entry.title: Transmutation of Elements through Capture of Electrons by Nuclei
entry.summary: A proton can capture an electron and turn into a neutron provided the electron has a kinetic energy of 0.782 MeV or more.An element of the Periodic Table can change into another on being exposed to such high energy electrons.

entry.title: What Maxwell's demon could do for you
entry.summary: In this highly speculative Letter it is argued that, under certain physical conditions, Maxwell's demon might be capable of breaking the second law of thermodynamics, thereby allowing a perpetual motion machine of the second kind, by accessing single particle capabilities.

entry.title: On the gravitational fields created by the electromagnetic waves
entry.summary: We show that the Maxwell equations describing an electromagnetic wave are a mathematical consequence of the Einstein equations for the same wave. This fact is significant for the problem of the Einsteinian metrics corresponding to the electromagnetic waves.

entry.title: Some methods of estimating uncertainty in accident reconstruction
entry.summary: In the paper four methods for estimating uncertainty in accident reconstruction are discussed: total differential method, extreme values method, Gauss statistical method, and Monte Carlo simulation method. The methods are described and the program solutions are given.

entry.title: Ultra High Energy Particles
entry.summary: We revisit considerations of temporal order in relativistic effects, taking into account Heisenberg's Uncertainty Principle. We then use a formulation of relativistic Quantum Mechanical equations given by Feshbach and Villars to exhibit novel particle antiparticle effects.

entry.title: Relativistic Quantum State, Geometric Phase and Dissipationless Spin current
entry.summary: Spin current of a Dirac particle is shown to be given by the geometric phase and in terms of the later, a closed form expression is obtained for the dissipationlessness of the spin current.

author.name: S. Arunagiri
author.arxiv:affiliation: POSTECH

entry.title: Relative localization of gravitational fields
entry.summary: A natural two-metric formalism, generated by the world function of the space-time, is used. This circumstance admits one to localize the relative gravitational field, which is described by a tensor.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Doclady Akademii nauk SSSR, vol.144, pp.1030 - 1033, (1962) (in Russian)

entry.title: The Pioneer anomaly and the holographic scenario
entry.summary: In this paper we discuss the recently obtained relation between the Verlinde's holographic model and the first phenomenological Modified Newtonian dynamics. This gives also a promising possible explanation to the Pioneer anomaly.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, Accepted for publication in Astrophysics & Space Science

entry.title: Sitnikov problem as a source of jets
entry.summary: Sitnikov problem, consisting two close binaries and a third small body is considered, leading to a rapid ejection of the small body from the binaries. This mechanism is proposed as an explanation of jets in many astrophysical systems. Choosing appropriate initial condition relativistic final velocities can be achieved.

entry.title: Five Differences Between Ecological and Economic Networks
entry.summary: Ecological and economic networks have many similarities and are often compared. However, the comparison is often more apt as metaphor than a direct equivalence. In this paper, five key differences are explained which should inform any analysis which compares the two.

entry.title: Physics of particles in the rotating tube
entry.summary: The classical and the quantum motion of a massive body in the rotating tube is considered. Photon is included. The spin motion described by the Bargmann-Michel-Telegdi equation is considered in the rotation tube and rotating system.

entry.title: Fast Light, Fast Neutrinos?
entry.summary: In certain media, light has been observed with group velocities faster than the speed of light. The recent OPERA report of superluminal 17 GeV neutrinos may describe a similar phenomenon.

entry.title: Quantum Cattaneo wave equation for ultra-short laser pulses interaction with electron and nucleon gases
entry.summary: In this paper the quantum Cattaneo wave equation for ultra-short laser pulses interaction with medium is obtained . The explicit formulae for electron and nucleon gases are presented
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Lasers in Engineering vol 20, No 1-2, p 47-53, (2010)

entry.title: On the equations defining the Ricci-flows of manifolds
entry.summary: The examples of the Ricci flows on four-dimendionsl manifolds which are determined by help of nonlinear differentials equations of the type of Monge-Ampere are constructed. Their particular solutions and their properties are discussed.

entry.title: Thermodynamic Functions for Body Centered Cubic Lattice- Application on Lattice Green's Function
entry.summary: Thermodynamic functions of ionic systems were evaluated analytically using the Green's Function for Body Centered Cubic Lattices. The free energy density, chemical potential, pressure, spinodals, and coulomb ionic potentials are expressed in terms of hyper geometric functions 3F2 and complete elliptic integrals

entry.title: Tunnel Effect or 'Saute-Mouton'?
entry.summary: An infinite well potential containing a rectangular barrier in its center is used to verify if the passage of a quantum particle through the barrier is described by tunnel effect or 'saute-mouton'.

entry.title: On the GR-speeds of light and particles (A remembrance of things past)
entry.summary: There are no limits for the speeds of light and particles in general relativity (GR). Four examples illustrate this basic result, which is too often neglected.

entry.title: Towards a quantum universe
entry.summary: In this short review we study the state of the art of the great problems in cosmology and their interrelationships. The reconciliation of these problems passes undoubtedly through the idea of a quantum universe.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, Accepted for publication in Astrophysics & Space Science

entry.title: Development for Hardware for Programming of Spatial Magnetic Field Distributions in Nuclear Magnetic Resonance and Magnetic Resonance Imaging
entry.summary: The proposal of a project aimed on a design of hardware for programming 3D Magnetic Field shapes over sample volume in NMR and MRI is described.

entry.title: Thermodynamics Basic Principles
entry.summary: Logical and mathematical aspects of the basic concepts of thermodynamics are considered.
entry.arxiv:comment: 41 pages, 6 figures, full Russian translation is included

entry.title: Storing unsteady energy, like photovoltaically generated electric energy, as potential energy
entry.summary: A proposal to store unsteady energy in potential energy via lifting masses with a rough quantitative overview. Some applications and methods to harvest the potential energy are also given. A focus is put on photovoltaically generated energy.

entry.title: Stochastic Physical Optics & Bell's correlation
entry.summary: With the use of classical statistical argumentation similar to the one used in e.g. statistical optics, it is demonstrated that in entanglement of photons, a classical realist explanation cannot be excluded by the CHSH measure in experiment.

entry.title: Contradiction of the DENSITY MATRIX notion in quantum mechanics
entry.summary: It is shown that description of a nonpolarized neutron beam by density matrix is contradictory. Density matrix is invariant with respect to choice of quantization axis, while experimental devices can discriminate between different quantization axes.

entry.title: Free Energy and Internal Combustion Engine Cycles
entry.summary: The performance of one type (Carnot) of Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) cycle is analyzed within the framework of thermodynamic free energies. ICE performance is different from that of an External Combustion Engine (ECE) which is dictated by Carnot's rule.

entry.title: On the LIGO-VIRGO search of coalescing-binary signals
entry.summary: No signal of the arrive of gravitational waves has been recorded by LIGO-VIRGO laser-interferometric detectors during recent science runs. We give a theoretical explanation of this fact.

entry.title: Scalar Field Theory on Supermanifolds
entry.summary: In this paper we will analyse a scalar field theory on a spacetime with noncommutative and non-anticommutative coordinates. This will be done using supermanifold formalism. We will also analyse its quantization in path integral formalism.

entry.title: On a minimum Column Density for Massive Star Formation
entry.summary: A fundamental physical basis is provided for the recently obtained minimum column density (1gcm-2) for massive star formation.

author.name: C. Sivaram
author.arxiv:affiliation: Indian Institute of Astrophysics, Bangalore

author.name: Kenath Arun
author.arxiv:affiliation: Christ Junior College, Bangalore

entry.title: Gauge Theory on a Four Sphere
entry.summary: In this paper we will analyze the quantization of a gauge theory on a four sphere. This will be done by mode expanding all the fields in the theory in terms of harmonic modes. We will also analyse the BRST symmetry of this theory.

entry.title: Infinite Face Centered Cubic Network of Identical Resistors
entry.summary: The equivalent resistance between the origin and any other lattice site, in an infinite Face Centered Cubic network consisting from identical resistors, has been expressed rationally in terms of the known value and . The asymptotic behavior is investigated, and some calculated values for the equivalent resistance are presented.

entry.title: Madelung rule violation statistics and superheavy elements electron shell prediction
entry.summary: The paper presents tetrahedron periodic table to conveniently include superheavy elements. Madelung rule violation statistics is discussed and a model for Madelung rule violation probability calculation is proposed. On its basis superheavy elements probable electron shell structure is determined.

entry.title: Metaphysics of the free Fock space with local and global information
entry.summary: A new interpretation of the basic vector |0> of the free Fock space (FFS) and the FFS is proposed. The approximations to various equations with additional parameters, for n-point information (n-pi), are also considered in the case of non-polynomial nonlinearities.

entry.title: SUSY Via Magnetic Monopoles and Chirality
entry.summary: A SUSY is proposed that interchanges bosons-fermions, and also transforms particle electric charge to magnetic charge, chromoelectric charge to chromomagnetic charge, and interchanges left-right handed couplings, leaving the masses between partners intact, and without R-parity. Constraints and consequences are discussed.

entry.title: Bell's fifth position is not supported by supermartingale statistics
entry.summary: It is demonstrated that the supermartingale statistics approach of Gill to the CHSH contrast contains a physical (and statistical) unrealistic assumption.

entry.title: Lorentz-Dirac equation in the delta-function pulse
entry.summary: We formulate the Lorentz-Dirac equation in the plane wave and in the Dirac delta-function pulse. The discussion on the relation of the Dirac delta-function to the ultrashort laser pulse is involved.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages. arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:hep-ph/0207274, and with arXiv:1007.4306 by other authors

entry.title: A Requiem For Schrödinger's Cat
entry.summary: It is pointed out that Schr\"odinger's celebrated "cat" paradox contains a simple error in reasoning regarding the definition of life. It is then shown that there is no paradox in the context of life as we currently understand it.

entry.title: Physics in discete spaces (C) : An interpretation of quantum entanglement
entry.summary: In this contribution we use the model of discrete spaces that we have put forward in former articles to give an interpretation to the phenomena of quantum entanglement and quantum states reduction that rests upon a new way of considering space and time.

entry.title: An apparent paradox in hydrostatic
entry.summary: It is shown that for a liquid in any connected vessels system, it is not possible to fulfill simultaneously Pascal's principle, mass conservation, and energy conservation. The viscosity has to necessarily be taken into account to understand the system change.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: European Journal of Physics 30(2009), L55 / European Journal of Physics 31 (2010), 249

entry.title: Unification after 150 years
entry.summary: In 1861, James Clerk Maxwell unified electricity, magnetism and light. Today physicists are trying to unify everthing else theoretically as well as experimentally with a view to develop a fundamental theory.

entry.title: Una paradoja hidrostatica
entry.summary: It is shown that for a liquid in a connected vessel system, it is not possible to fulfill simultaneously Pascal's principle, mass conservation and energy conservation when the system goes from an equilibrium state to another one.

entry.title: What fuel for a rocket?
entry.summary: Elementary concepts from general physics and thermodynamics have been used to analyze rocket propulsion. Making some reasonable assumptions, an expression for the exit velocity of the gases is found. From that expression one can conclude what are the desired properties for a rocket fuel.

entry.title: Some topics in thermodynamics and quantum mechanics
entry.summary: We sketch some connecting relations involving fractional and quantum calculi, fractal structure, thermodynamics, and quantum mechanics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 28 pages. A few misprints are corrected. arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:0911.5392 by other authors

entry.title: The myth of cell phone radiation
entry.summary: We discuss the purported link between cell-phone radiation and cancer. We show that it is inconsistent with the photoelectric effect, and that epidemiological studies of any link have no scientific basis.

entry.title: Remarks on numerical relativity, geodesic motions, binary neutron star evolution
entry.summary: The computations of numerical relativity make use of (3+1)- decompositions of Einstein field equations. We examine the conceptual characteristics of this method; instances of compact-star binaries are considered. The preeminent role of the geodesic motions is emphasized.

entry.title: Astronomy and the Fifth Dimension
entry.summary: Astronomy is a precise and relatively simple science because objects accelerate in a gravitational field at the same rate, irrespective of their composition. Galileo knew this, and Einstein took it as the basis for general relativity. Surprisingly, it is also a consequence of new theories that use a fifth dimension.

entry.title: The first order equations for scalar bosons
entry.summary: It is shown that, in contrast to the generally accepted opinion, there exist first order equations for the scalar bosons. Such equations are proposed below. They are similar to the Proca equations and Maxwell equations for the vector bosons.

entry.title: The \c{hi}2-test, the Muon AMM and Karl R. Popper
entry.summary: In this very brief note, we only wish to identify a simple but notable epistemological basis, concerning the Karl R. Popper philosophy of science thought, into the realm of the experimental proves of Fundamental Physics.

entry.title: On the $q$-Laplace transform in the non-extensive statistical physics
entry.summary: In this paper, q-Laplace transforms related to the non-extensive thermodynamics are investigated by using the algebraic operation of the non-extensive calculus. The deformed simple harmonic problem is discussed by using the q-Laplace transform.

entry.title: Two-dimensional Ising model in a finite magnetic field for the square lattice of infinite sites-Partition function and Magnetization
entry.summary: The partition function and magnetization equations are derived for the two-dimensional nearest neighbour Ising models in a magnetic field.

entry.title: Realization of Einsteins Machian Program
entry.summary: The Einsteins Machian Program is here accomplished.
entry.arxiv:comment: This version differs from the published paper. arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1106.5388

entry.title: A note on Gibbs paradox
entry.summary: We show in this note that Gibbs paradox arises not due to application of thermodynamic principles, whether classical or statistical or even quantum mechanical, but due to incorrect application of mathematics to the process of mixing of ideal gases.

entry.title: Introduction aux méthodes d'intégrale de chemin et applications
entry.summary: These lecture notes are based on a master course given at University Hassan II - Agdal in spring 2012.

entry.title: On the Laplacian of 1/r
entry.summary: A novel definition of the Laplacian of 1/r is presented, suitable for advanced undergraduates.
entry.arxiv:comment: The last paragraph of Section 3 is generalized, 8 pages

entry.title: Gravitational Self-Energy and Black Holes in Newtonian Physics
entry.summary: A definition of a Newtonian black hole is possible which incorporates the mass-energy equivalence from special relativity. However, exploiting a double spherical shell model, it will be shown that the ensuing gravitational self-energy and mass renormalization prevent the formation of such an object.

entry.title: On the Origin of the Lorentz Transformation
entry.summary: The Lorentz Transformation, which is considered as constitutive for the Special Relativity Theory, was invented by Voigt in 1887, adopted by Lorentz in 1904, and baptized by Poincar\'e in 1906. Einstein probably picked it up from Voigt directly.

entry.title: Cumulative Probability of Blast Fragmentation Effect
entry.summary: This paper presents formulae for calculation of cumulative probability of effect made by blast fragments. Analysis with Mott distribution, discrete fragment enumeration, spatial non-uniformity, numerical issues, and a generalisation for a set of effects are also discussed.

entry.title: Nonlinearity and linearity, friends or enemies? Algebraic Analyzation of Science:)
entry.summary: Certain operator-valued functions and new generating structures (instead of generating functionals) are proposed for the analysis of equations for n-point information (n-pi). Some remarks are made concerning the intertwining of linearity and nonlinearity, and functions defined on non-numerical objects.

entry.title: A Model for Neutrinos
entry.summary: Neutrinos are the weirdest of elementary particles, nearly massless and chiral. They oscillate between flavours, furthermore. We try to find a rationale for this maverick behaviour.

entry.title: Solar Coronal Heating and Limb Effect
entry.summary: The quiet solar coronal heating problem and the observed center-to-limb wavelength variations of the solar lines (limb effect) can be explained. In this paper the quantitative calculations for these two phenomena are presented.

entry.title: Quarks and leptons which might be composite
entry.summary: An option of composite quarks and leptons is briefly outlined, where elementary color-triplet quark-like fermions are bound with an elementary color-triplet isoscalar scalar boson due to the color coupling 3* x 3* -> 3 and 3* x 3 -> 1, respectively.

author.name: Wojciech Krolikowski
author.arxiv:affiliation: University of Warsaw

entry.title: What is a photon?
entry.summary: We discuss the absorber theory of radiation as put forward by Wheeler and Feynman. We show that it gives a better understanding of the photon compared to the usual quantum electrodynamics (QED) picture.

entry.title: Einstein's Miraculous Year
entry.summary: With each passing year, the young Albert Einstein's achievements in physics in the year 1905 seem to be ever more miraculous. We describe why the centenary of this remarkable year is worthy of celebration.

entry.title: The Dark Mass Problem
entry.summary: I discuss some of the basic properties of a potential theory derived from a modified Newton's law of action at a distance that includes a $1/r$ attractive force.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, minor notation changes, 2 figures added

entry.title: Scattering of scalar waves on a single crystalline plane
entry.summary: Scattering of a scalar particle on a crystalline plane with quadratic cell and identical fixed scatterers is solved precisely. Contradiction of the standard scattering theory is pointed out.

entry.title: It From Bit and The Unsmooth Reality
entry.summary: In this short essay it is argued that the "It from Bit" idea is plausible when assuming "generalized bits", resulting from the Kolmogorov superposition theorem, as universal building blocks.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, submitted to FQXi 2013 Essay Contest - "It from Bit or Bit from It"

entry.title: High Energy Dirac Solutions: Issues and Ramifications
entry.summary: In this paper we consider solutions of the Dirac equation at ultra high energies. The study provides new insights including features overlooked thus far and also new ramifications.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages latex; Invited talk at FFP13, November 2013

entry.title: The modified electromagnetism and the emergent longitudinal wave
entry.summary: The classical theory of electromagnetism has been revisited and the possibility of longitudinal photon wave is explored. It is shown that the emergence of longitudinal wave is a consequence of Lorenz gauge (condition) violation. Proca, Vlaenderen & Waser and Arbab theories are investigated.

entry.title: Point-like source solutions in modified gravity with a critical acceleration
entry.summary: We consider equations of modified gravity involving critical accelerations and find its solutions for the point-like source by suggesting the appropriate symmetry of metrics in the empty space-time.

entry.title: Is Bohm's interpretation of quantum mechanics consistent?
entry.summary: The supposed equivalence of the conventional interpretation of quantum mechanics with Bohm's interpretation is generally demonstrated only in the coordinate representation. It is shown, however, that in the momentum representation this equivalence is not valid.

entry.title: Discrete Noether Currents
entry.summary: We present a simple generalization of Noether's theorem for discrete symmetries in relativistic continuum field theories. We calculate explicitly the conserved current for several discrete spacetime and internal symmetries. In addition, we formulate an analogue of the Ward-Takahashi identity for the Noether current associated with a discrete symmetry.

entry.title: Mond - a review
entry.summary: A critical appraisal of developments in MOND since its introduction by Milgrom in 1983 to the present day.

entry.title: Modern elementary particle physics
entry.summary: The purpose of these lectures is to describe the state of affairs in modern particle physics to young physicists who do not specialize in this subject.

author.name: M. I. Vysotsky
author.arxiv:affiliation: ITEP

entry.arxiv:comment: 53 pages, in Russian, lectures presented at the School of Physics of the Rosatom State Corporation, Sarov, April 2013

entry.title: Concrete incompleteness & Bell's theorem
entry.summary: For a subset of 2 dimensional unit parameter vectors, Bell's correlation formula with local hidden variables reproduces the quantum correlation. This is unexpected considering a general no-go LHV claim derived from the same function.

entry.title: Galactic Charge
entry.summary: We investigate the hypothesis that the core of a galaxy has a positive electrical charge with an equal and opposite negative charge distributed over the galactic periphery. We present a determination of the amount of charge needed to explain the apparent anomalous rotation behaviour.

entry.title: The Tunneling Transform
entry.summary: We supplement the Lorentz transform $L(v)$ with a new "Tunneling" transform $T(v)$. Application of this new transform to elementary quantum mechanics offers a novel, intuitive insight into the nature of quantum tunneling; in particular, the so called "Klein Paradox" is discussed.

entry.title: Modular architecture of isospin, color, and generation
entry.summary: Starting from the vacuum, iterated Grassmann-algebra formation consecutively introduces vector spaces and groups with the structure first of charge, then of isospin, then of color.

entry.title: The Moessbauer effect in homogeneous magnetic field
entry.summary: We derive the probability of the Moessbauer effect realized by the charged particle moving in the homogeneous magnetic field, or, in accelerating field. The submitted approach represents new deal of the Moessbauer physics. Key

entry.title: Trying to understand dark matter
entry.summary: We present some "back-of-the-envelope" calculations to try to understand cold dark matter, its searches, and extensions of the Standard Model. Some of the insights obtained from this exercise may be useful.

entry.title: A simple and universal setup of quasi-monocolor gamma-ray source
entry.summary: Strict classic 3-D dynamics theory reveals that arbitrarily high center frequency light source can be achieved by flexible application of not-too-strong static electric field and static magnetic field. The magnitudes of the fields are not required to be high.

entry.title: The Quantum-Relativistic Dynamics of the Universe
entry.summary: From the analysis of the quantum and relativistic properties of the particles it results the unified quantum-relativistic dynamics of the physical reality (Universe).
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Advanced Studies in Theoretical Physics, Vol. 6, 2012, no. 25, pp. 1215 - 1223

entry.title: Nonlinear electrodynamics and black holes
entry.summary: We investigate a new model of nonlinear electromagnetic field coupled with the gravitation field. The black hole solution is obtained possessing the asymptotic Reissner-Nordstr\"om solution. The electric field has the finite value at the origin and there are not singularities.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 1 figure, accepted for publication in IJGMMP

entry.title: On Constancy of the Speed of Light in the Global Positioning System
entry.summary: The speed of light in the global positioning system (GPS) is theoretically investigated through the analysis of navigation equations together with metric tensors for light speed constancy.

entry.title: Galaxy clusters and the nature of Machian strings
entry.summary: The model of Machian space quanta is applied to the dark matter problem in galaxy clusters. Machian space quanta are able to solve the missing mass problem if all the mass of a space quantum is assumed to be in the Machian strings.

entry.title: Dirac equation in the Nonsymmetric Kaluza-Klein Theory
entry.summary: We rederive Dirac equation in the Nonsymmetric Kaluza-Klein Theory gettig an electric dipole moment of fermion and CP violation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages ,no figures,submitted as a contributed talk to the 2nd conference of the Polish Society on Relativity : 100 years of General Relativity

entry.title: Could quantum mechanics describe completely and consistently all superconducting and other quantum phenomena?
entry.summary: Canonical description of quantization effects observed at measurements on superconducting structures seems one of the most triumphant achievements of quantum mechanics. But impartial consideration uncovers incompleteness and inconsistency of this description. Contradictions in the description of other quantum phenomena are revealed also.

entry.title: Boosted Statistical Mechanics
entry.summary: Based on the fundamental principles of Relativistic Quantum Mechanics, we give a rigorous, but completely elementary, proof of the relation between fundamental observables of a statistical system when measured relatively to two inertial reference frames, connected by a Lorentz transformation.

entry.title: Free fall temperature of Schwarzschild-Tangherlini-AdS black hole
entry.summary: Investigating five-dimensional Schwarzschild-Tangherlini-AdS black hole, we construct a (6+2)-dimensional flat embedding structure. Exploiting this flat manifold, we evaluate a free fall temperature of the black hole in manifold ranging from outer event horizon to the infinity.

entry.title: Methods for solution of boundary value problems in domains with disconnected boundaries
entry.summary: We present here a review of existing analytical methods to solve boundary value problems of diffusion in media containing N non-overlapping inclusions.

entry.title: Lorentz Invariant Vacuum Solutions in General Relativity
entry.summary: All Lorentz invariant solutions of vacuum Einstein's equations are found. It is proved that these solutions describe space-times of constant curvature.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. Steklov Inst. Math. 290 (2015) 138-142; Trudy Steklov Mat. Inst. 290 (2015) 149-153
